campaign.story:
This animation project is launched by WIT STUDIO.  
 ■We've Already Reached our ¥20,000,000 Stretch Goal!
■Thank you ¥10,000,000 supports!!
＜from Nagabe＞
＜from Directors＞
■Announcement: stretch-goal
Thank you very much for all your support from the bottom of our heart. We are happy to share an exciting stretch goal for this project with you! Apologies for taking much more time to make the announcement than we expected.  We appreciate your continuous participation in this project to bring additional excitement to "The Girl from the Other Side."
 If we reach ¥13,000,000...
 -One storyboard booklet and one behind-the-scenes booklet will be added to the Blu-ray package. 
*This will automatically be added to any rewards of Tier 3-12. 
*This will be a bilingual version (Japanese and English). 
 If we reach ¥16,000,000... 
-The Author, Nagabe sensei, will create an original Manga episode available online only to the supporters.  
If we reach ¥20,000,000...
 -WIT STUDIO will make Nagabe 's weekly illustrations into a short-animation.
 *The short-animation will be around 30 seconds. 
*The animation will be created in an innovative style (black-and-white animation, etc.)  that respecting the original Manga's expression.
Announcement: An add-on for the "Comic Book of the Spin-off Story" is now available
As requested by so many supporters, we have set an add-on which lets them select the "Comic Book of the Spin-off Story" together with any rewards of Tier 3 - 12 which include the Blu-ray of the animated feature. This is also available for supporters living outside Japan!  *The "Comic Book of the Spin-off Story" is available in Japanese only. *The additional shipping cost will be charged for the add-on.  
<How to Select the Add-on> 
-For new supporters 
①Click 「Back this project」in kickstarter page 
②Choose the reward that you like  
③Choose the Add-ons that you like ＆Delivery area 
④Choose your payment method ＆Click 「Pledge」  
 -For the supporters who already backed any rewards 
①Click 「Manage」in kickstarter page 
②ーon application：Click「Edit reward」ーon Website：Click「Change your pledge」
③Choose the reward that you like  
④Choose the Add-ons that you like ＆Delivery area
⑤Choose your payment method ＆Click 「Pledge」
 "The Girl from the Other Side" is a dark fantasy, the story of a world in which a human girl Shiva and a cursed, non-human "Teacher" live.
The original comic series by Japanese manga artist Nagabe was published in 2015 by MAG Garden, to close its epic story with volume 11, set to publish on April 9, 2021.
The work, with its unique touch and a worldview reminiscent of picture books and poetry, has been translated into multiple languages and received positive reviews from around the world.
The short art animation "The Girl from the Other Side" created in 2019 ahead of this crowdfunded project was officially invited to nine international festivals including the Ottawa International Animation Festival, receiving great reviews, not just at home but from all around the world.
The new project looks to create a longer feature-length animation as the culmination of this work. 
[New attempts and resolves]
In 2019, we created a short animation for "The Girl from the Other Side." I would like to ask all of you to watch part of it, any part or fragment of it. You will see new attempts at animation. New attempts do not mean something eccentric.  We see it as the ability to make videos to order, to the project's potential.
This project of ours is based on three resolves, which we want to see crystallized. The first new attempt in this project stemmed from the originality of the original work. We felt that the original work had unique expressions not confined to the framework of manga. Likewise, we would like to create an animation that is not bound by the framework of animation even though it will be an animation. All the production members are ready to face this challenge head on.
Second, we developed the animation's workflow in house. With Directors Yutaro Kubo and Satomi Maiya at the center, we will look to the union of creators engaged in animation through a totally different process in advertising, in-house production and cell animation.
Third, we will aim to create a movie with a consistent concept despite its long length. Creating long movies takes more resolve and determination than creating short movies, even in using just one-time expressions. New attempts that seem outrageous at first glance always need to be started by someone with a strong resolve. We are looking to artwork that will be able to stand shoulder to shoulder with innovative existing movies. And it is with this resolve that we will take on this project.
<WIT STUDIO Producer Kenta Yamada>
In this project, the biggest challenge was probably the fact that people allowed us to work as the directors. In usual circumstances most people would think that using us, with little experience in the field of TV animation, would be risky.
But the key point of this project is that we needed to think of a new approach to producing from scratch. It involves not just thinking about how to bring the storyline to life but with what kind of lines and texture should be used for the art and characters. We are focusing on these small details, exploring the best approach for "The Girl from the Other Side." We hope that we can bring a movie to you that is new yet unique "The Girl from the Other Side," with the original work's uniqueness and appeal sealed in animation. Stay tuned!
 When the animated short-film was produced before, the original world of "The Girl from the Other Side" was fully respected with distinctive expressions of animation. I was impressed by such challenges and potentialities of expressions at that time. This time, with the great cooperation of many people, an one-hour animation, much longer than the previous one, will be produced. I would be so happy if we work on this project together with you guys to make the new animation much more splendid. Thank you for your cooperation in advance.
 <<Message>> WIT STUDIO representative: Joji Wada
Thanks to the support of many fans, WIT STUDIO was able to celebrate its 10-year anniversary this year. To date we have released many works, including "Attack on Titan" and "The Ancient Magus' Bride" and now, we would like to explore new ways of expression and publishing in anime to help us move forward to the next phase.
Indeed, you may call this work a blueprint for that potential. Thankfully, the short OAD movie has received positive reviews far beyond our expectations. Due to these positive reviews we decided to create this "art animation" in a long movie. We look forward to this new challenge to the diversity of animation.
This crowdfunded project is an attempt to improve the quality of this movie and to let more people know about it. We would like this attempt to be an opportunity for animation production studios and anime fans all around the world to connect with each other, however little.
This project is a huge challenge for WIT STUDIO as we head toward the next 10 years. We appreciate your kind support to our production team, as the team forges ahead to future possibilities.

<<Message>> Original work editor: Kyohei Shinpuku
The sunlight does not cover everything in the morning, and the darkness does not reveal everything at night. This is the quiet story of the two, living patchy evenings—the story of "The Girl from the Other Side." Thanks to the readers of the original work truly loving Shiva's dedicated love and Teacher's poignant honesty, we were able to draw this story to the end. The author and we thank you from the bottom of our hearts.
In a world that does not change for the better, how can two people with different points of view accept each other? Living in today's world we are always posed with this question, which is illustrated in this original work by Nagabe in manga forms reminiscent of children's story and poetry. This work is filled with five years of Nagabe's heart and soul.
How about taking this extremely pure and beautiful crystal and turning it into a movie, maintaining its purity and in a way that portrays the original work more accurately ? I would like to make it a story that everyone who loved the original work truly wishes for. When I came to that point in my thinking, I felt that we needed help from you who loved the original work, in addition to the original framework of producing animation. Yes, no one else but you, from around the world, who love the original work.
The closure of this story work will mean the end of our beautiful friendship, but this project will be a new beginning for the friendship between you and "The Girl from the Other Side."
Your kind support is deeply appreciated.
In Japan, it usually takes a budget of over 10 million yen to create one episode (about 25 minutes long) of a TV animation.  
Before we begin I would like to reassure all our supporters that the production committee has already secured a certain amount of production funds to create this long animation, and that there is no risk of this project being completely aborted.
That said, we intend to use the support fund from you for the activities shown below.
[(1) Fund to improve the production quality]
Usually a TV series requires the flow to become efficient, from drawing original drawings to movies, colorings and photo shooting, as the process involves many staff members.  However, in "The Girl from the Other Side," we will put in more effort and time than we would in the usual workflow, devoting more effort into photoshoot processing to present the original work's fairy-tale-like worldview. (* For the actual image, see the comparison below.)
PLAY

Usually for animations created with WIT STUDIO, photoshoot processing section shown above is worked on jointly with external production companies, but this time we will organize an internal photoshoot team for the first time ahead of production. It is a special use of the fund to make this work stand out as an art animation.
[(2) Promotional expenses]
We will use the fund for the items below for the PR to notify people around the world of this product.
Cost of organizing advance screening with staff talk show
Cost of producing an online event with English translation
A translation fee to release production interviews to overseas media
* We will use the fund for other PR measures to communicate this work's appeal to as many people as possible.
* Details of the descriptions above are subject to change.
We intend to move things forward ensuring as much transparency as possible to our supporters on the use of the support fund. Your kind support to the long art animation project "The Girl from the Other Side" is greatly appreciated.

campaign.story:
What if the world had a little more glitter and a touch of color... 
Fairies are everywhere. There’s not a culture that hasn’t told tales of tiny tricksters, benevolent creatures, or winged sprites that weave their magic into the world. It’s inevitable that such creatures would, over time, influence our imagination and inspire countless pieces of art. 
And so, we present A Touch of Color 
A Touch of Color features original illustrations of fairies in all sorts of bright and exciting environments, whether baking cakes, weathering the elements, or dancing to a forbidden tune. Each artist was assigned a color to focus their piece on, and so conceptually, the anthology is divided into sections for each color, creating a rainbow as you flip through. 
With over 48+ pages of content, A Touch of Color is the collaborative effort of 50+ super talented artists who put their heart and soul into creating a vibrant and colorful fairy-themed zine.

THE RELAUNCH
Following our last campaign, the mod team behind this project put their heads together to make a spectacular comeback! 
What’s changed?
We have lowered our goal from $3,300 to $1,400. Our original goal took into account free compensation copies of the zine for contributors. This time around our main focus will be to go to print first!  The stretch goal levels have also been adjusted to better reflect our new goal.
**NOTE: WE ARE NOT ACCEPTING UK ORDERS AT THIS TIME

campaign.story:
(Welcome to The Academy)
Explore the ruins of a magical school tucked deep within the forest. 
The Academy was once on the verge of discovering magic that could pierce reality. To protect its hard-earned knowledge from the outside world the school sealed itself within an immense, opalescent bubble, waiting for the day when it could unveil the culmination of its progress. But that day never came, and the school was left to molder within its impenetrable cocoon. 
You, treasure hunters, have found a way in.
The Academy Chrysalis is a scenario for Trophy Gold, a collaborative roleplaying/ storytelling game about treasure hunters exploring an environment that doesn't want them there.
The Academy Chrysalis takes the feel of Trophy Gold and blends it with ideas of Dark Academia, experimental magic, and barriers to knowledge. In doing so, it seeks to interrogate ways of knowing as systems of power, and explore what it means to treat knowledge as a thing to be treasure-hunted.
(Oa, the Knowledge-Giver. Art by Ezra Rose)
(What is Trophy Gold?)
Trophy Gold, by Jesse Ross, tells the story of treasure-hungry adventurers in a dangerous world. Easy-to-understand rules and quick character creation make it a perfect entry point for roleplaying newcomers, and its uniquely collaborative mechanics make it a refreshing take on storytelling for seasoned roleplayers.
In Trophy Gold a Game Master - or GM - uses a pre-designed scenario like The Academy Chrysalis as a framework to tell a story with other players who embody treasure hunters. Whenever treasure hunters want to learn more about the world or do something dangerous, the players roll different combinations of six-sided dice to determine the outcomes of their actions. Importantly, the GM and the players all work together to interpret these outcomes, leading to beautifully creative and engaging stories that the GM couldn't have envisioned alone. 
 Never played Trophy Gold before? No worries - the rules are included in the zine. 
Trophy Gold scenarios rely on themes - atmospheric tools that the GM uses to evoke coherent imagery during play. The use of a theme helps tie descriptive moments back to the greater ideas in the story. In the Academy Chrysalis, navigate a world tied together with the theme of bubbles: scenes of encasement, iridescence, fragility, weightlessness, and popping reality pervade the school and its grounds.

(Things contained within)
(Cover, details not final)
This 5.5 x 8.5" zine will include:
 Basic rules for playing Trophy Gold that will prepare you to run a game, even if you've never done it before.
 A 6-set incursion (i.e., an adventure with six acts) that has the treasure hunters explore the grounds of a ruined magical school. 
 Unique tables for character creation, including names, backgrounds, skills, equipment, and rituals.
 New items, monsters, and scene-setting aids to help the GM create engaging play sessions.
 A new mechanic that adds an extra dimension of utility and chaos to ritual casting.
 Approximately 32 pages of content in total - saddle stitched and printed on 130# matte cover and 80# uncoated black and white interior - professionally printed by Mixam.

(The creators)
Patrick Monari (designer, cover/layout artist) - Patrick Monari (he/they) is a full-time creature of academia. As a PhD student in Wisconsin, he studies the neuroscience of community and collaboration to uncover how love changes who we are. His work has appeared in scientific journals on neuroscience and behavior, and he's thrilled to be applying his canny attention to detail to his first Kickstarter. | patrickmonari.com / @howlsandowls |
Ezra Rose (interior artist) - Ezra Rose (they/them) is an illustrator, zinester & mixed/multi-media creator living on a small farm in Western Massachusetts with queer chosen family. Their art explores monsters, magic, queer/trans identity and Jewish culture, celebrating the marginal and connecting to the symbols and stories of both past and present. Ezra's work has appeared in tabletop games, comics anthologies, and other small/indie press. | ezra-rose.com / @magpietongue |
Savannah Gentry (interior artist) - Savannah Gentry (she/her) is an independent graphic creator based in Wisconsin working with digital media and traditional pen and ink. Her pen and ink art delves into aspects of nature in a zentangle stylistic form and her digital art explores character creation and storytelling. Savannah's work has appeared on organization websites, event promotions on social media, and created for individual commissions.  | @kawaiifungi |
Ballantyne (interior artist) - Ballantyne (they/them) is an amateur multi-media artist living in Japan - a small planet in a big universe. Their art focuses on the chaotic, and reflects the intersection of personal-emotional awareness and external validations of beauty. You can find their work as paper gifts, slipped secretly from one hand to the next.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my first Kickstarter, and one risk is that things will take longer than I expect. However, the project is currently progressing on track. The layout design is almost entirely finished and the interior art is all complete. Writing is about halfway done, and the whole incursion is outlined and storyboarded. Once funds have been collected it's simply a matter of finishing/editing writing, fine-tuning art placement and layout, and incorporating playtest feedback. 

I expect to be going to print in mid-June, with a delivery of print copies sometime in August. I don't expect any shipping delays, but considering that the world is such a mess right now it remains a possibility. Should that happen, I'll update backers regularly.

updates.update_content:
Thanks so much for your incredible support! As I’m writing this we’re *just* over 300% funded at the end of day 3, and we’ve hit the last stretch goal – this means we’ll be paying our artists more money for their awesome work!

So much of what I’m learning makes Zine Quest a beautiful thing is that it injects so much life into the indie ttrpg scene all at once. With a temporally-focused platform, small creators like me get a chance to show off their work to an attentive audience, and it’s so encouraging to see enthusiasm spread across projects. With that in mind, I want to share some other Zine Quest projects that are going on right now that I really like! There are so many that look amazing, though, so I'll add some more in future updates. Both of these campaigns are ending in less than 24 hours, so you should check them out soon if you can!

campaign.story:
High on the treacherous and perpetually frozen peaks of Mt. Abbot lies a forgotten gold claim registered to one Jakob Weidner. Decades ago, maybe more, Weidner packed up his family of six and built a homestead on a small, unforgiving parcel of land in a desperate bid to strike it rich. Initially he was called a fool, but, for a time at least, rumor was that Weidner had actually managed to find something in the mine. Then everything went quiet. Perhaps tragedy struck the family before Jakob could make good on it or, perhaps, driven to anger by ridicule, he simply chose to break with society altogether. No matter what happened, the mine still sits somewhere on the mountain, waiting for the right person to uncover its location and retrieve whatever riches it keeps hidden...
The Lord of Wolves is a grimdark Trophy Gold incursion originally written for the Trophy Gold Incursion Contest in 2020 and inspired by dark legends and histories of the American west, Appalachian folklore, and western horror movies like Ravenous(1999). In it, your treasure hunters will brave an abandoned and treacherous mountain pass in a desperate bid to recover whatever gold might have been excavated from the lost mining camp beyond. Along the way you'll hazard vertical ice shelves and flesh-starved animals; you'll stumble into the horrible history of the mountain and learn the tragic fate of the family that once called the pass home while attempting to survive the ever-darkening echoes they've left behind. Will you return from Jakob's Folly? And if so, would it be better if you hadn't?
Since the initial Incursion Contest submission, The Lord of Wolves has been edited, vamped up with new occupations and backgrounds, adorned with dozens of haunting illustrations, and laid out beautifully in a half-letter zine format that gathers darkness the deeper in you go.
What awaits you...
A 26 page, 5.5" X 8.5" digital zine for use with the Trophy Gold rpg system
A tale of desperation and hunger set in an abandoned mountain mine camp
Fully illustrated throughout with both original artwork and manipulated public domain images from the late 1800s
Bespoke randomized loot tables and special new rules
Five sets filled with evocative props, heartbreaking traps and treasures, and unique and deadly monsters
Four new Treasure Hunter occupations
Four new Treasure Hunter backgrounds
A sinister yet deceptively innocent villain to carry forward into your next incursions
Every copy purchased above asking price will generate a free community copy once The Lord of Wolves goes to Itch.io 

Because this is our second Zine Quest project this year, we're running The Lord of Wolves as a PDF only campaign. We know that will turn many of you off, but it will help us focus on completing our previously funded game, ALL MUST BOW, while we learn the ins and outs of dealing with a printed and shipped product on that front. The good news is The Lord of Wolves is already complete in every way and will be available immediately following the campaign, so you won't have to wait months to receive it. It's also priced lower than most other PDF products we've seen and if you grab it while it's on Kickstarter you'll be saving about 50% off the final Itch.io price.
In The Mine...
Content Warning
The Lord Of Wolves contains the aftermath of violence against women and children, and depictions of cannibalism. If any of these are a trigger for any member of your playgroup please talk to your group before running this game or consider finding a different incursion entirely. Additionally, the author and Bleak Horizons Press recommend using safety tools at your table to insure that everyone involved is respected, has a voice, retains a positive experience, and, of course, feels safe before, during, and after play.
Some recommended safety tools include:
The X-Card by John Stavropoulus. For more information please visit the Google Doc page HERE. 
Lines & Veils, a device developed by the gaming community at large. For more information please click HERE.
Further information on safety tools in general can be found on the Gauntlet RPG Forums at https://www.gauntlet-rpg.com/tools-of-the-table.html

Ex Libris...
Ryan Hatt wrote The Lord of Wolves and is responsible for creating the cover art, layout, formatting, textures, some original illustrations, and all artistic manipulations of public domain art found within. He is also the co-writer and principal illustrator for ALL MUST BOW, our flagship project that just successfully funded here during Zine Quest, as well as co-owner of Bleak Horizons Press.
Josh Flaccavento helped to proofread and edit The Lord of Wolves. He is also co-writer and designer for ALL MUST BOW and the other half of Bleak Horizons Press. He is co-host of the “superhero” podcast “Tales from Stringersberg"which is worth investigating.
Melissa Brigham proofread, edited, and consulted on the interior art for The Lord of Wolves. Her help and support is immeasurable. 
Follow Bleak Horizons Press on Twitter HERE

Hi everyone,
Thank you so much for jumping in to The Lord of Wolves! I'm happy to see that so many people are interested in my dark little incursion this long after the contest and this far into ZineQuest. I don't know about you all, but I've already bought more zines than I planned to.
As the campaign steadily moves forward I'd like to reinstate that The Lord of Wolves will be available immediately following the successful conclusion of this Kickstarter, either through a coupon on Itch.io or through a direct download link from Google Drive or something similar. campaign.story:
Introducing Midnight City Tarot: a vibrant, modern deck inspired by The Fool's journey through New York City. Based on the traditional 78 card tarot system, but re-imagined with a uniquely metropolitan twist, these hand-illustrated cards bring the magic of the big city into the palm of your hand.
This is the Tarot experienced in New York City.
A spread using the Midnight City Tarot deck
Featuring art that breaks the borders and extends beyond the binary, this welcoming candy-colored deck invites you to imagine yourself and the people in your life within each of the cards. The detailed scenes depicted on every card convey their meaning, making it effortless to pick up this deck and receive messages on day one. For additional support, each deck comes with a guide-book that provides an overview of the art, the meanings of the cards, as well as their locations within The City. The approachable style of the art makes this deck great for beginners and seasoned readers alike. 
The Magician and The Lovers cards from the Midnight City Tarot Deck
Created by a New Yorker, the Midnight City Tarot deck is full of iconic landmarks, as well as scenes of city life further off the beaten path. This deck is meant to feel like a day in the life of a New York City witch. 
You'll find subway sign card titles on every card to help you traverse through Midnight City, with each suit color-coded as if it were the MTA.
The Major Arcana from the Midnight City Tarot Deck. (Artwork subject to slight adjustments.)
The two-part box is fully illustrated with scenes of city life.
This tarot deck was created for City Witches past, present and future. Whether you live in New York City currently, dream of moving there someday, or perhaps you lived there in a past life, this deck will help bring that unique city magic to you, no matter where you are.
This first-edition of the deck launched on Kickstarter comes with:
A fully illustrated two-piece rigid box for safe keeping
78 cards printed on 310GSM linen paper stock
A guidebook with the meanings of the cards
Access to Midnight City Stories - exclusive behind-the-scenes content only available for members
A thank you note for helping to bring this project to life!
The Magician card from the Midnight City Tarot Deck
The Artwork 
Thank you for checking out this project!
* A note about The World pledge level. The US shipping was supposed to be free, but there was a little mishap and Kickstarter won't let me change since it has already been backed. The US shipping is $5, so to make up for this, I'll be upgrading shipping to UPS and including a special surprise gift for everyone who backs this pledge level. Thank you so much for your understanding and support. This is my first Kickstarter project - thank you for hanging in there with me!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I worked so, so hard on this deck, from perfecting the drawings, to hiring a talented tarot reader to proofread the deck and guidebook, to sourcing a US-based printer. As a Virgo rising, I really appreciate the details and I've done everything I can to mitigate any risks.

The mail being a little uncertain these days does present a risk. It is my absolute dream that this deck arrives to you promptly and in perfect condition. If anything happens to your reward during shipping, please reach out to me and I'll do my best to make it right.

If you are outside the USA, I am so excited to ship to you! Please note that you will be responsible for all customs and applicable taxes, including VAT.

campaign.story:
Maybe you can relate... 
As empaths, we are so tuned in to the experiences and emotions of others and ourselves. In daily life, this can be powerful because we can intuitively know things that others miss.
But when we experience trauma—whether a major incident or a seemingly small heartbreak—we can end up holding that trauma in our bodies.
Usually, this happens without us even realizing it! And what is heartbreaking is how frequently we respond by disconnecting from our bodies.
That’s why I have created the Chakra Healing Tarot.
No matter what you have been through, no matter what you are facing now, even if you have zero experience with Tarot, the goal of the Chakra Healing Tarot deck is to help you connect with your inner healing.
The archetypes of Tarot have been combined with the wisdom of chakras (your energetic body) in this Chakra Healing Tarot deck. With this deck, at any time, you can immediately pinpoint which chakras need attention, why they need attention, and how to give them the attention they need.
Here are the specs of the Chakra Healing Tarot deck:
Based on the Rider-Waite-Smith tradition
78 full-colour standard Tarot-sized cards (2.75” X 4.75”), printed on high quality 350 GSM art cardstock with a smooth matte finish
Borderless imagery with rounded corners; card titles on each card
Card backs are fully reversible
Sturdy, full-colour keepsake box
A comprehensive guidebook to help you every step of the way. Perfect bound, 200 pages (100 double-sided pages), Tarot card-sized, comes in the box with the cards
The deck combines Eastern spiritual knowledge (the chakras) with the wisdom of the Western mystery traditions (the Tree of Life in Qabalah)
The glowing jewels on each card make it clear which chakra(s) you're working with and where they are in your body
The artwork and guidebook are fully complete and will be sent for printing once the campaign is successful!
In the Chakra Healing Tarot deck, you will see that Major arcana cards take you to sacred temple grounds at the top of a mountain.
Most of the Major arcana cards have TWO chakras on them! This means there is an important connection between two of your chakras, and it is a connection that’s worth exploring.
Three of the Major arcana cards have ALL the chakras on them, indicating key milestones on your journey through the Major arcana. These three cards with all the chakras include the Fool, Wheel, and World cards. 
Here are some of the Majors!
The Minor arcana cards take you to four magical kingdoms:
Wands: This suit takes you into the mystical caves at the base of a sacred mountain. These cards represent your spiritual and aspirational energy (how you are motivated, your values)
Chalices: These cards take you to a flowing, watery kingdom. This suit represents your emotional energy (how you feel, includes ALL emotions!)
Swords: This suit takes you to a kingdom in the clouds. These cards represent your mental energy (how you think, your mental cycles)
Pentacles: These cards take you to an enchanted forest. This suit represents your tangible energy (how you give or receive tangible things. Tangible things are things you can touch and feel like money, belongings, your physical body, etc.)
In the Chakra Healing Tarot deck, the Minor Arcana cards have ONE chakra on them. Check out the Minor kingdoms below!
Here are some of the Wands!
 Check out a few of the Chalices!
 Aren't these Swords just breathtaking?
 These Pentacles, though!
Each deck includes a 200-page (20,000 words) Tarot-sized guidebook complete with instructions, card meanings, a Chakra Healing Tarot meditation, Tarot spreads, and a Chakra Healing Tarot ritual. The guidebook will fit into the box with the cards.
Each card meaning in the guidebook includes:
Which chakra(s) the card corresponds to
A Chakra Healing Message
Key phrases that are grouped into "Vibrant" and "Suppressed"
The planetary/elemental energy associated with each card, based on the planet, sign, or element assigned to each Tarot card in the Western mystery tradition
Traditional key phrases so that beginners can build up Tarot knowledge
 Tarot Newbies: Even if you have never picked up a Tarot deck before in your life, that's okay! This deck is gentle, beautiful, and accessible. The guidebook is comprehensive and will guide you every step of the way! You will be able to read these cards for yourself.
 Tarot Enthusiasts, Advanced Readers, and Professional Readers: This deck applies a chakra healing lens to your existing knowledge of the Tarot. This can enhance your readings with additional energetic body insights—a powerful complement to the archetypal wisdom of the Tarot. Of course, you can also use this Chakra Healing Tarot as your go-to deck for clients who are drawn to the magical, diverse art.
 Reiki Practitioners and Other Energy Workers: Created by a Reiki Master, this deck can help you identify the chakras your clients most need assistance with during a session. Pulling a card from this deck can help you pinpoint the relationships between chakra issues for your clients. The Chakra Healing Tarot will also provide you with insights into the context and nature of the issue. These are all powerful insights that will help you provide even greater support and healing to your clients.
As a certified Reiki Master, Malumir has worked with clients' energy centres extensively. Through this experience and her own healing over the years, Malumir has seen the importance of helping people connect with their bodies by healing their chakras.
An experienced Tarot reader, Malumir’s passion for the Tarot is a long-term, committed relationship! She firmly believes that the complexity and universality of the Tarot system and the archetypes it contains can help anyone find the insights they need. This is why Malumir has created the Chakra Healing Tarot!
Also an NLP Master Practitioner and public policy professional, Malumir is so passionate about helping people rediscover the inner power that has always been within them. Neurologically atypical and living with less visible [dis]abilities, Malumir also loves cycling, running, and is always thinking about her next tattoo!
Ella Mazur is a Toronto-based artist working in ink and colouring her works digitally to create vibrant dream worlds.
Her art is inspired by the magic all around her: the diversity of creatures and plants that inhabit our planet, the endless depths of the ocean waves, the enchantment of the forests, and the mysteries of the stars in the sky.
Malumir is so grateful that Ella was willing to take her on as a client for such a significant project! Ella has created such stunning art that has brought Malumir's written descriptions to life so perfectly.
Your support for this campaign means everything to me and for this Tarot deck! The revenue from this campaign will go toward the production of this deck. 
Reaching the crowdfunding goal means that each backer will receive one copy of: 
Chakra Healing Tarot deck, First Edition, first print run
Guidebook for the Chakra Healing Tarot deck
Certificate of Authenticity
Mystery Magnet
 And of course, there are some super exciting stretch goals!! Let's see how far we can take this together!
The artwork and guidebook are fully complete! That means that as soon as the crowdfunding successfully concludes, I will be able to send the deposit and artwork to the printer!
The production and delivery time from the time I send the files to the printer to the time I receive the decks' shipment is approximately 3 - 4 months. Barring any unforeseen challenges, I expect to receive the decks in Summer 2021. I will ship the decks out as soon as I receive them.
I will ship out orders by backer group (via Backerkit) based on geographic location as the primary filter. My home is extremely small and I will be doing all the shipping myself, so will need to keep the assembly line process as simple as humanly possible!
I don't expect any production issues with my incredible and very experienced Tarot printing company. Still, I will be sure to update you all at least biweekly on the status of production.
Your support means everything to make this deck a physical reality! Please support this project so that I can bring it into your life!
Shipping for this deck will be collected AFTER successful crowdfunding (via Backerkit). Why? Because of the way crowdfunding works, if I raise funds needed for both the deck and the shipping, once the crowdfunding platform fees are taken off as a percentage, I could actually be OUT money and not have enough to pay for shipping!
So, to keep things simple, your shipping will be extra and will be charged separately AFTER successful crowdfunding (see estimates below). I will be using Backerkit to collect shipping from you; I’m sure many of you are very familiar with Backerkit! If you're not familiar, Backerkit is awesome! It lets you track progress and get updates as campaigns you support develop and deliver, plus it makes life easier for creators by keeping your info up to date and helping to make sure the shipping you pay makes sense for where you live. PLUS - this way, it's a little easier for you to manage the costs, because it spreads out the costs of your reward and shipping. 
Estimated shipping costs: So that you can plan for the extra shipping charge, below are estimated shipping costs. If I can get a better discount once fully funded (depending on the number of backers), I will reflect those in the shipping costs. Here are the estimates at this time for a single deck (larger shipments may cost extra):
Canada: $12CAD (about $9USD)
US: $15CAD (about $12USD)
UK: $25CAD + $15CAD for VAT (see note below) (in total about $31USD)
Other International: $27CAD (about $21USD)
A few more notes on shipping:
Customs: Your deck will be declared on the customs form as a "Tarot deck," without exceptions. It is your responsibility before backing to confirm that your country permits Tarot decks' import. If the package is seized by customs and not returned to either one of us, then regrettably, the order is non-refundable. If, however, customs returns the deck to me, to even out the burden of cost between us, I will issue you a refund for the cost of the deck only (no refund on postage fees).
UK orders - VAT fees: New VAT rules as a result of Brexit mean that I need to collect VAT on UK orders. Lots of creators and small business owners simply are not accepting UK backers/orders at this time, but I want to at least give you the option! This means that I will be collecting VAT at the time that I collect shipping for UK backers, via BackerKit. I am not liable for any additional customs fees or charges your country may charge you though. 
Non-UK international orders - customs or VAT fees: It is your responsibility to be current on any customs fees or VAT taxes that may apply to you on your order. I am not liable for customs fees or VAT taxes that your country charges you, the importer, for purchasing overseas, nor am I responsible for any delays in delivery on account of customs. Please be aware that some countries do not permit the import of Tarot or playing cards, so please check to confirm that your country permits the import purchase of Tarot or playing cards. For customs purposes, I must declare the contents and full value of the package. I appreciate your understanding in this matter.
Shipping times: As we are all very aware, the global COVID-19 pandemic has significantly increased the volume of shipments delivered by ALL carriers worldwide. As carriers work to adjust to these significant increases, shipments can often be delayed. Please be patient and kind. 
Timely pickup: While most shipments will go directly to your door, you may receive a notice to pick up your parcel from your local delivery or post office. If you receive a notice to pick up your parcel from your local delivery/post office, remember that you only have a limited time to pick up the parcel. If you don’t pick it up before that date, it will be shipped back to me (or will disappear into the ether and will be permanently lost!). I will not be responsible for replacing or refunding any missing orders because you did not pick up your parcel on time. If it is sent back to me, I will ship it out to you again, but you'll be responsible for the cost of postage to reship. 
Delivery date: The delivery date provided is my best approximation made in good faith but cannot be guaranteed due to factors that may be out of my control. You will be kept up to date at least biweekly on the deck’s progress during the production and delivery (to me from the printer) phase.
campaign.risks:

This is my first experience crowdfunding a project, and I do work a full-time job. However, I have put my part-time Tarot, Reiki, and coaching services on hold since Autumn 2020 so that I can focus my evening, weekend, and vacation time to work on bringing this deck into the world! I am committed to getting these decks into your life with your help of a successfully funded campaign!

The artwork and the guidebook are already fully complete. I want to get these decks into your life as soon as humanly possible, so I will provide the artwork and deposit to the printer once this crowdfunding campaign is successfully concluded!

I do not expect any production issues. I am working with a credible printer that is very experienced in printing Tarot and oracle decks. As we all know, the global COVID-19 pandemic has been a factor in timelines for shipping services in the past year. Regardless, I will be sure to provide you with biweekly updates on the printing and shipping status.

Non-refundable: Please read through all descriptions of the deck carefully before deciding to back the Chakra Healing Tarot. I will not issue refunds because you have changed your mind or decided that you do not resonate with the deck once the project is backed. You would be free to sell your copy second-hand or used. However, I won’t be able to give you a refund or participate in facilitating your second-hand sale.

campaign.story:
I AM DRAWING A FULL TAROT DECK! 
Are you dreaming? No! After yeeeears of being asked - THIS IS REALLY HAPPENING, and you can PRE-ORDER A PACK by pledging today! Also I have a tonne more merch available as rewards for different donation amounts so loadsa options available if you don't care for Tarot Stuff! And EVERYTHING CAN BE SHIPPED WORLDWIDE!!
This will only go ahead if I managed to sell 400 decks so don't wait and get one at a later date cos if I don't raise the money I won't do it!

I am drawing all 78 original cards, each one PAINSTAKINGLY hand illustrated by yours truly, plus one really pretty original reverse design, an illustrated box to store them in PLUS a brief fold up instruction manual for those of you who are new to Tarot reading.
There are also a tonne of other merchandise bits up for grabs, goodie bags, enamel pins and prints so please read the rewards section for more!
*example cards that have been used to create tattoos in the past
ALL FUNDS DONATED TO KEEPING GRANNY’S ATTIC TATTOO STUDIO OPEN - WITHOUT HITTING OUR TARGET WE WILL CLOSE DOWN!
Most of you will know me as a tattooist, but this year tattooing has been out of the question for the majority of the year (for obvious reasons!) leaving me and my studio completely without an income. The long and short of it is, after paying rent for a closed studio for almost a year, we are going to close - UNLESS I CAN SELL 400 DECKS! Every penny of the goal figure will be donated to keeping my little studio open and keeping me and my amazing team in a job after this pandemic is over. I need to sell 400 decks of cards to keep my shop. Please buy one! And tell your friends/family/colleagues/pets to buy one, we wanna see the lil shop keep living!
Some snaps from the happy lil studio!
These cards are going to be BEAUTIFUL. You can use them for their intended purpose, you can frame them and hang them on the wall - it’s like getting 78 mini-prints for the price of like 2 regular prints! 
If you like my work, it’s a no-brainer. They make a great gift* for the art fan in your life, or a bloody great gift for yourself cos you deserve all the gifts in the world after this shitter of a year!
*please note this is pre-order and delivery won’t be until approx. July 2021 so don’t buy ‘em as a gift for anyone with a spring birthday pls!!

WHAT CAN I BUY?
It’s not just cards on offer! At different donation levels you can get different exciting things:
1. Full 78 card Tarot Deck - £39.00.
 This is the main event and I would encourage everyone to buy one of these! But there are plenty of other donation brackets for people to check out….
2. A5 prints - £9.00.
- or 5x Prints (various sizes) as part of the 'All Artists' print pack = £29.00
There will be 8 different A5 prints to choose from, 4 from myself (@esmebakertattoo) and 4 from the rest of the Granny's Attic Tattoo family - 
@alexinetattoo
@baikal.13
@reevetattoo
@mhairi_stella_tattoo
3. Death Tarot Enamel pins - £12.00
4. A4 prints - £14.00 Each
- or 5x Prints (various sizes) as part of the 'All Artists' print pack = £29.00
There will be 8 different A5 prints to choose from, 4 from myself (@esmebakertattoo) and 4 from the rest of the Granny's Attic Tattoo family - 
@alexinetattoo
@baikal.13
@reevetattoo
@mhairi_stella_tattoo
5. Goodie Bags - £35.00. (Containing tote bag, enamel pin, sheet of temporary tattoos, an A5 print and stickers)
6. Original Artwork - £60.00-£65.00.
Every single original illustration will be available to buy as original artwork. Please select your preferred card on the drop-down. Only one of each card exists so be quick to make sure you don’t miss out on your favourite! They are all A4 sized, signed and dated. I always draw on lightweight tracing paper as that’s the way my pens glide the best. The actual illustrations are 14cm tall.
7. Full 78 card deck of Tarot Cards PLUS a Goodie Bag - combo discount!! - £69.00.(Containing tote bag, enamel pin, sheet of temporary tattoos, an A5 print and stickers)
8. Full day tattoo sessions at a discount rate! - £450.00.
People who can donate £450 will receive a voucher for one full day session with me for redemption when we re-open. There are only 4 of these available so be quick!
There are some terms and conditions that apply with this so please make sure you read them before opting for this level!
*examples of some of the merch up for grabs! (Please note that these photos are not exactly representing what is in the goodie bags as they will be filled with brand new artwork that is not yet drawn!)
WHY EXACTLY £15388.00?
All of the target money is going to help cover the never-ending costs of the tattoo studio I operate. We have had barely any chance to work, and therefore almost no income since the end of March last year, but I still have rent and bills to pay on the shop and after so many months of COVID closure I had maxed out my credit cards, drained my savings and exhausted my options for loans and am now left with 2 options - close the studio and make my amazing colleagues redundant, OR see if I can raise it through merch sales! So here we are - I am giving our little tattoo shop ONE last chance of survival by making these tarot cards.
As for a cost breakdown:
Although the latest news from the government is promising, there are expected to be disruptions and restrictions placed on the tattoo industry in the UK until the end of summer. Plus, as I am completely out of money, I can't even front the costs of re-opening at this stage (things like re-stocking equipment and paying staff). This means I am likely to have to keep paying rent and all the bills that go alongside running my business without any guaranteed income for another half a year. This figure for this alone comes to £6,848.00.
But I didn’t want to just ask for charity to cover these costs, I want to create something that you guys have been asking for! But of course this incurs some costs too; the production and postage of these cards. To get them a good quality, and to buy them in a relatively small batch (around 400 as this is my goal amount of sales) the cost of the production is £6,100.00. I also had to account for a certain amount of worldwide shipping included in the price**, as otherwise shipping becomes prohibitively expensive, so that accounts for another £900, taking the total to £13,848.00 
**(Depending on where you are in the world there are small fees for postage for all the rewards so please check this before you make a pledge). 
The final cost is a combination of taxes, payment processing fees and the fee for kickstarter itself; if I hit my target it’ll cost me at least £1540.00 in fees and taxes, so to be able to afford this campaign I have to include that one last cost, bringing the grand total to £15,388.00.
I look at that figure and I don’t know if I am gunna be able to make it. But I know how many people our little shop has touched. And I know that I am going to create the best artwork and pour my love and heart and soul into every drawing I do here.

Also - there is no risk with this donation for you! If we do not raise the money needed to save the shop, and the money needed to produce the cards and prints, you get your donation back. But please at least pledge something cos it might mean we can keep the studio and if we can then you can still come get tattooed by all your favourite artists here at Granny’s Attic Tattoo.

***For full disclosure - I applied for and received the self-employed grant - unfortunately this is calculated purely on profits, and totally neglects expenses of a business such as mine. As the expenses of my studio are not much lower than my turnover annually, this means that I actually make a very low amount of profit per year - and this in turn means that when my calculation came through it was not even enough to cover the rent of my small flat, let alone enough to live off and support the studio on. I have also contacted our local council multiple times for financial assistance but to no avail.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Of course there are some risks and challenges to overcome here, but the main one is actually selling enough decks of cards. 400 sounds like a darn big number. But I really have faith in my ability to create a mind-blowing product and I hope you can see the potential like I can!

The other risk is having issues with the manufacturer which could potentially cause delays. But I plan to combat this by giving a later deadline than originally planned - I have left 2 whole months to allow for issues with production to arise and be rectified and still get the cards shipped out to everyone by July 2021.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

With her many phases, the moon illuminates and shadows the realm of consciousness where we see the unseen and comprehend the incomprehensible. We are not alone in this other world; we have guides that help us understand visions as night opens the gate to a higher understanding. The LUNA Tarot cards visualize those who walk in the realm of night and guide you to interpret the messages given.

Why revisit the Ethereal Visions Tarot Deck?
When Matt first approached the Ethereal Visions Tarot project in 2016, the intent was to stay true to the traditional Art Nouveau style of the early 1900s. Over the past few years, the deck has gained world-wide attention touching so many lives. Many of the deck admirers have reached out to Matt requesting a second deck with more diversity. This spawned the Dreamscape Oracle Deck (which began shipping in October/November 2020). This oracle deck allowed Matt to explore that same original Art Nouveau style but with more diversity and creativity.
The overwhelming response that the Dreamscape Oracle received inspired Matt with images to update the Ethereal Visions Tarot Deck. That creative spark has yielded The LUNA Tarot Deck, a revisited version of the Ethereal Visions Tarot Deck with more diversity, richer colors, special iridescent silver foil, and 8 brand new cards (stretch goals could release more)!
These two beautiful decks long to be used together to deliver the messages where the Dreamtime veils part and the moon whispers her secrets.
UNLOCKED: Two bonus cards have been added to the deck! It will now be an 80 card deck!

The LUNA Tarot Deck consists of 80 cards. Each card is illuminated with special iridescent silver foil stamping unique to that specific card design. The cards are high-quality 3x5 inch cards on 350 GSM black core stock with rounded corners. The decks come in a two-piece heavy box with an expanded 120-page booklet describing each card's symbolism and its use in a reading. 
This Kickstarter is for the premier first edition of the LUNA Tarot Deck.

The LUNA Tarot Deck shares the same card size and weight as the  Dreamscape Oracle Deck making it a perfect companion for your readings.

Each card is illuminated with a unique iridescent silver foil stamp design
Premium heavy 350 GSM weight black core card stock
Easy-to-hold and shuffle format
14 completely new card designs (Includes 2 additional cards. Stretch Goals unlock more) 
Unique design to card back
Two piece premium box with iridescent silver foil design
Expanded 120-page booklet describing the idea behind each card
Richer, More Diverse Designs
Matt Hughes has revisited the illustrations on each card from the Ethereal Visions Tarot Deck to create an updated, more refined design. The richer, dreamy color palette is a perfect companion for the Dreamscape Oracle Deck.
Below are some examples of this exquisite deck. More cards will be shared here as Matt produces them.
 ** Bonus Card Revealed - AGAPE (Click here to read more 
Exquisite Card Back Design
The moon conveys her knowledge through her many phases. From waxing, full, waning, to darkness she whispers her gifts to her many messengers. A silver thread beautifully weaves her path as she dances through the darkness of night.
UNLOCKED: Now all LUNA tarot decks will have silver foil edging added to the cards!
UNLOCKED: There will now be silver ink on the card backs!
No deck is complete without an exceptionally gorgeous box. This two piece premium box is a culmination of elements from the LUNA Tarot Deck. Best of all, the box design will include its own elegantly designed iridescent silver foil accent on all five sides!
The most sought-after editions are those that the artist signs. With this reward, Matt will sign and number only 50 decks. Each of these 50 decks will come with the below signature card signed and numbered by the artist as well as a matching numbered sticker on the back of the box to commemorate this highly limited edition!
Which Reward Tiers Include This?
The two reward tiers that include this edition are the SIGNED LUNA Tarot Deck for $150 and the SIGNED LUNA & SPECIAL SUPPORTER listing for $200 (this reward also includes your name in the decks booklet).
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main obstacle facing this project has always been the uniqueness of the cards. Not only will each card be an original piece of artwork but the incorporation of iridescent silver foil to the deck has exposed new challenges. One of these challenges has been the acquisition of a reputable printer who can handle such a project. Luckily we have acquired such a printer before even launching this campaign. Therefore, the only real obstacles that we may face in the delivery of this project will be potential delays in printing and or shipping. If such a delay happens, all backers will be made aware the issue immediately.

campaign.story:
The Insect Tarot is, predictably, an insect-themed tarot deck, with major and minor arcana as well as a companion guide full of insect facts and tarot card explanations.
All designs and products shown here are subject to change as I continue to prototype and proof the deck and companion guide.
How I Got Here
When I was six years old, I spent Thanksgiving making a "menu" of different insect traits and asked my relatives to choose one from each category, then gave them drawings of the imaginary creatures. Clearly, I haven't changed much.
I'm constantly juggling side projects in addition to my job making games. I don't finish  many of those projects. I definitely didn't plan on finishing this deck when I started it nearly three years ago. But something about it kept me coming back, slowly making one card at a time as the world changed around me.
More of my work can be found at shermansplanet.com.
The Deck
The deck contains 78 sturdy tarot-sized cards (2.75" x 4.75") with a smooth matte finish. It comes in a rigid two-part box with designs on the top and sides.
Insects, with their metamorphoses and biological castes and extreme ecological diversity, provide a wealth of symbolism that can be worked into a tarot deck. Each individual card has been paired with an insect, but additional symbology is spread across multiple cards. For instance, five cards in the major arcana line up to tell the story of the Fool's Journey as portrayed by a universal symbol of change and growth: the monarch butterfly.
Each of the minor arcana suits is associated with a type of eusocial insect that appears on the aces and court cards: bees (cups), termites (pentacles), wasps (swords), and ants (wands). Other motifs tie the entirety of each suit together.
The Guide
The companion guide is a perfect-bound 4"x 6" booklet with a smooth finished matte cover. It contains a short intro and a full page description of each card. Here are two sample pages:

campaign.story:
The invention of time travel brought infinite possibilities.
There's just one rule: don't change the past.
...but rules don't apply to you, do they?
Loot the past, destroy the future!
Echoes of Chaos is a narrative roleplaying game about hubris and greed; about straying off the safe path for personal gain and glory at the cost of the future. This desire for personal gain is at the heart of the game – it drives the players to take risks, betray each other, and ultimately cause the kind of chaos that echoes through time and renders the future unrecognizable.
Rooted in Trophy and inspired by Ray Bradbury's A Sound of Thunder, Echoes of Chaos is a narrative-first system that features players taking on the roles of Tourists: time travellers who have an ulterior motive for visiting the past. Working with the Game Master and their fellow players, Tourists will attempt to achieve their selfish goal, but in doing so run the risk of altering the future in wild and unpredictable ways. 
You will begin by creating this world together: deciding what the Present is for your tourists... is it cyberpunk dystopia, a shimmering utopia, or a slightly more tech-heavy version of our own world? What do your characters love and hate about the world they are departing from? Working together you'll set a baseline for the way things are... and then watch that world unravel as you loot the past.
Using a risk-based six-sided dice pool, you'll adventure through time in pursuit of your selfish goals (and helping or hindering your fellow Tourists in pursuit of theirs'), slowly earning Echoes - the consequences of interfering with the past. In the finale of the game, these Echoes will determine how much the future has changed, through a variety of fun and creative randomized tables... or you and your table can decide what you think changed!
The goal of Echoes of Chaos is to provide a fun guideline for exploring chaos theory, the butterfly effect, and other time travelling hijinks while leaving plenty of room for customization and improvisation. Follow the rules or just use them as inspiration - whatever helps you and your players have the best adventure!
How to Play
A session of Echoes of Chaos begins by creating The Present: this is the world your characters will be departing from to travel back in time. The creation of The Present involves setting some baselines for the world: the type of government, the state of the world (at war, on the brink, at peace), the nature of culture, etc. This can be done in advance by the Game Master, decided on collectively at the start of the session, or randomized by rolling on a table. Once the state of The Present is decided, the players choose their characters.
Character creation is a lightweight process in Echoes of Chaos, involving deciding on a Motivation: this is the ulterior motive your Tourist has for travelling to the past and your main objective for the game. You will also get to equip your character with Enhancements that will grant them powers, at the cost of Stress... you might have a cool laser rifle, but knowing that you're smuggling it will make you more paranoid and prone to panic. With Motivations in mind, you will then determine the nature of your Tour.
Each game is made up of several Tours, where the characters will attempt to achieve their goal and cause the Echoes that will alter The Present in a variety of ways. The group is travelling together, so much like taking a shared Uber, your Tourist may end up in some unexpected time periods and situations and can decide to help or hinder the group as they see fit.
Eventually, after each Tourist has attempted their goal, the Tourist return to the Present, where the Echoes of Chaos they have caused will determine how much has changed from what they left behind. In this finale, all the classic time travel consequences come true (think Back to the Future: Part II's Biff World) and the characters must reckon with what they've done.
Together in a single session, you'll create a new world, explore its past, then destroy its future... for fun and profit! (Well, maybe not profit. But definitely fun!)
What's included in the Zine?
Full rules to run Echoes of Chaos
Lightweight set-up for easy one-shots
Randomized tables to generate The Present and the effects of the Echoes of Chaos
Advanced rules for non-randomized set-up, alternative scenarios, and modified gameplay
Time travel hijinks! Future-altering consequences! Real-time, collective speculative fiction creation!
The Inspiration
Hi! I'm Tom, the designer of Echoes of Chaos. I've always loved Ray Bradbury's creative, exciting short stories and A Sound of Thunder has always captivated me: a team of hunters goes on a time safari to hunt a tyrannosaurus rex, on the condition that they stay on the designated path... needless to say, things go badly, and a panicked hunter steps on a butterfly, turning the utopian future they left into a fascist hell. It's fun, Twilight Zone-y stuff and has inspired lots of fun stories, from The Simpsons' time travel toaster, to the movie Butterfly Effect, to a somewhat questionable film adaptation of the short story itself, and more.
Prompted by The Gauntlet and ZineQuest, I started thinking about fun ways to remix the brilliant Trophy RPG by Jesse Ross and realized there was a fun opportunity to build on the themes of Trophy - greed, hubris, and the slow erosion of the characters - and apply it to a time travelling sci-fi adventure: and so, Echoes of Chaos was born!
Having GMed professionally for a podcast network for the past few years, I've grown to love narrative RPGs that leave a lot of room for collaboration and mutual world-craft - leaving the players room to help develop the world and story they're interacting with. Echoes is an extension of this, with the players and GM working together to build (and destroy!) the world. My hope is that it will create short, memorable adventures - and do the memory and legacy of Ray Bradbury proud!
...well, prouder than Butterfly Effect did. I hope.
Stretch Goals
We've got lots of fun stretch goals planned, from a Campaign version add-on (to play over multiple sessions, returning between Tours to The Present which has been altered more and more each time), to a printable deck of random Pasts, Presents, and Consequences, to being able to pay our collaborators more (our cover art is by the amazing winters860 who really went above and beyond!)
All this and more (?!) will be announced once the project is funded!
Special Thanks
I was able to commission our cover art thanks to a generous loan from The Gauntlet, an amazing RPG community (including CODEX magazine, Trophy, Brindlewood Bay, and more) and I quite literally could not have done this without them. If you're into RPGs (and really, if you're still reading this I gotta imagine you are), please check them out: they are an incredibly supportive and engaged community. Extra special thanks to Jason Cordova (creator of Brindlewood Bay, which is absolutely brilliant) for setting this all up.
And thanks to winters860, the amazing artist who created our cover - an absolute joy to work with and I can't recommend them highly enough.
And, of course, to the great Ray Bradbury: for inspiring this, and so much more.

campaign.story:
TOKEN is a game about a hero and monster circling each other in a haunted forest, offering gifts and signs of their intent—the story ends when they meet and face one another at last.
This one-shot, GM-less duet game is inspired by dark fairytales and folklore. “Token” refers to symbolic objects or gestures that express what words cannot—offerings, gifts, or promises of something more. Play as the Seeker, a failed hero with a haunted past, or the Dweller, once a human, now stalking the forest in their monstrous form.
(art by Madeleine Ember)
 "Token perfectly encapsulates what I love to see in fairy tales of a hero facing a monster: the initial mystery and fear of otherness slowly being replaced by understanding, familiarity, and empathy." 
—Jesse Ross, creator of the Trophy RPG
TOKEN is a collaborative game Rooted in Trophy: using a rules-light, narrative-rich framework to encourage risky choices, and evocative storytelling. 
TOKEN is GM-less, meaning both players take turns making rolls, describing the world to each other as their characters face challenges. 
Both characters must balance the risk of losing themselves with their drive to find the other, while keeping the threats of the Forest at bay.
The World
Players collaborate to create a dangerous landscape looming with horrors, then set out in search of each other, facing challenges and discovering strange new features of the environment along the way. A series of tables expands the setting beyond a Forest, if you choose. 
For example, you might set the story in an expanse of snowy peaks, haunted by spirits of lost travelers or a deep marsh, polluted by futile wars, crawling with restless dead.  
(art by Ezra Rose)
The Characters
Character creation in TOKEN is simple, using a series of expanded tables to choose the Past that haunts you, your Identity (for the Seeker) and monstrous Features (for the Dweller). Both characters have a driving Instinct (a motivation for seeking the other), which changes throughout the story and is finally acted upon during the game's epilogue. Scars are the manifestation of physical injuries gained during the journey or emotional wounds from the past. Charms are dangerous magic powers which both characters may use. Finally, both characters have a Secret about their shared past which is revealed during the final scene if the game—offering a final dramatic chance to influence how the story ends.
You might play characters such as:
 A Seeker with a family curse, who is an Elder, Fighter, and an Outcast, seeking to slay the monster which haunts the woods to put an end your family curse. 
A Dweller who once was a lost hunter, now Ancient, Ravenous and Many-Limbed, seeking to reunite with your long-lost kin so that you may look on the beauty of the world outside. 
Mechanics
TOKEN adapts the dice rolls from Trophy Gold and adds a new mechanic of its own. Dice rolls may result in the player gaining a Token, acquiring a Scar, or increasing the threat of the Forest:
 Reflection Rolls (similar to the Hunt Roll in Trophy Gold) are made when searching the Forest for clues of the other. 
 Challenge Rolls (similar to the Risk Roll in Trophy Gold) are made when facing a threat of the Forest directly.
 Enticements tie both characters more closely together as Tokens may be exchanged to heal Scars and change Instincts. 
Epilogues
There are 3 ways the game can end:
A player gains 3 Tokens, narrating their first reaction when both characters meet.
The Forest gains 3 Tokens, and a growing horror engulfs both players.
A player gains 3 Scars, and is mourned by the other in an epilogue.
(art by Ezra Rose)

—Blaine Martin, creator of the You Are Not Alone podcast

Writing & Game Design:
Gabriel Robinson (he/him) @trollhands lives in Norfolk, VA with his wife and their small creatures, where he writes, works in healthcare and runs therapeutic role playing games. His first game Candlelight was published as part of Zinequest 2. His incursion Leviathan's Bridge won first place in the Trophy Gold writing contest in 2020. His writing is also featured in the Trophy RPG (Dark, Gold & Loom) and Sunken.
Layout Design:
Cathode Youth is a small design studio from the Pacific Northwest. We became fans of graphic design through album cover art, magazine layout, punk rock fanzines, action figure packaging, skateboard graphics, coffee table books, and rave fliers. We continue to apply the ethos and attitude we learned from these subcultures to our current endeavors—be they branding, layout, packaging, merchandise, or copywriting. Despite the state of digital world domination, we remain stubbornly committed to things that are printed. cathodeyouth.com
Cover and interior art:
Ezra Rose (they/them) is an illustrator, zinester & mixed/multi-media creator living on a small farm in Western Massachusetts with queer chosen family. Their art explores monsters, magic, queer/trans identity and Jewish culture, celebrating the marginal and connecting to the symbols and stories of both past and present. Ezra's work has appeared in tabletop games, comics anthologies, and other small/indie press. | ezra-rose.com / @magpietongue |
Interior art:
Madeleine Ember (she/her) @MadeleineEmber writes, illustrates, and generally makes a nuisance of herself at any opportunity. She lives with her partner and two cats in Camas, WA; where they together create many strange things.

STRETCH GOAL WRITERS:
Linda Codega (they/them) @_linfinn is an avid reader, writer, and fan. Like most of us, they have a website and also a Twitter. They moonlight as an author, cultural critic, and narrative game designer. They are also the game development editor for Codex, a monthly role-playing game magazine. They live in between a mountain and a river, and can usually be found on one or the other, depending on the season.
Mags Maenad (they/them) @MaenadMags is the author behind the Rooted in Trophy game CLIMBING THE WITCH'S TOWER, a fairytale game about pursuing an elusive witch up their tower.
Nicholas Masyk (he/him) @nicholasmasyk is a roleplaying game designer and longtime GM from Montreal, Quebec, Canada, and creator of Monkey's Paw Games. His games seek to inject anti-colonial, anti-racist and anti-fascist narratives into the lens of science fiction, fantasy, and horror through projects such as numerous Trophy Dark Incursions as well as his own works such as UNCONQUERED, Chalice, and SMILE, which can be found at https://monkeys-paw-games.itch.io/.
Jamila Nedjadi (they/them) @temporalhiccup is the creative force behind Sword Queen Games and they believe in the power and magic of creative play. Their game BALIKBAYAN: Returning Home was nominated for the IGDN Indie Groundbreaker Award for best setting. Jammi is also a co-host of The Gauntlet podcast, a community podcast that focuses on play and indie TTRPGs.
Pam Punzalan (she/they) @thedovetailor is a game designer, writer, editor, sensitivity & cultural consultant, and community organizer from the Philippines. Her games are explorations on the fringe, reclamations of topics and themes that are often barred to her and her own, adaptations of popular tropes and archetypes, and a good mix of sweetness and light that dances on the darker edges of human experiences.
Michael Van Vleet (he/him) @signalstation is the author of several Trophy Dark incursions, including the award-winning A WARM AND PLEASANT HUM, and DEVIL, AIM FOR ME, a Weird West incursion, as well as contributions to the Trophy core books, coming out this year.
Skye Zentz (she/her) @skyezentz is a professional songwriter and music educator who has served as composer and lyricist for the Emmy award-winning series “Green Beats”. Skye teaches songwriting & ukulele at The Muse Writers Center in Norfolk Virginia. She loves friendly monsters and cozy sweaters.

High quality print through Mixam, or a printed hardcover via DriveThruRPG, will last a lifetime (zines lost in stray forest paths not guaranteed).
Reusability and recyclability
TOKEN can be passed from friend to friend and replayed as many times as you wish - as long as you keep it protected from the elements. Mere paper will not withstand a game played in a bog or sunken cove.
Sustainable Distribution
Print-on-demand options for overseas backers will significantly reduce shipping costs. Canadian backers will have their orders printed in Canada via Mixam and fulfilled through our friend Nicholas Masyk at Monkey’s Paw Games.

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
Thanks so much for your patience as Token slowly develops within its cocoon of bark, moss and bone.  Its been a challenging month or so for writing but I'm very excited with how the game is coming together. Here's where the project stands:
The full game draft has been sent to the editor! I'm very excited to be working again with Lauren McManamon, who edited my first game Candlelight, and is the editor for Trophy where all my RPG writing started. The game now includes 7 scenarios, expanded tables for locations, lore, and question prompts, player guidance for solo games and younger players, and guidance for writing your own scenarios.

The TOKEN campaign is complete!

I can't wait to share all of the expanded content with you, and hear about your games! I'll keep you updated every few weeks or so as the project continues. Feel free to reach out with any questions or to chat about games, weird folklore, and general inspiration—I'm on Twitter @trollhands and would love to hear from you.

Hi everyone!
We're almost at the end of the campaign—thanks so much for you support! With less than 2 days to go, I wanted to review our progress, highlight the final stretch goal and mention a few options still available to backers. Thanks so much for your support in getting us here!

With 6 days left in the campaign, TOKEN is going strong and steadily approaching our big stretch goal! Thanks for being a part of the journey with your continued support!

updates.update_userinfo: Happy Valentine's Day & A Short Story Preview
updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone!
Whether you are spending the day with a loved one, seeking a companion in the perilous wilds, or dwelling content in your safe and cozy lair—here's to you on this celebration of hearts! Thank you, as always, for your continued support in bringing this project to life.

Now, a short story. This is my own retelling of the "broken token" ballad, of which there are many variations (such as ), all describing the tale of a maid who waits patiently (for YEARS) for her betrothed to return. In one way or another, he returns in disguise and tests her faithfulness through a series of questions (with no mention of his activities during all those years abroad). When she indicates that she has waited for him faithfully all this time (usually by presenting a token of their love), he finally reveals himself to be her long-lost love.
