campaign.story:
PLAY

People have been after me for years to write a cookbook. But until covid-19 scaled back my graphic design assignments, I never had time. ‘Round about May, I started sifting through my recipes and collecting cherished ones from family and friends to produce this culinary love letter to my state, my kinfolk and my farm-spent youth. These recipes brought families and friends together for generations and provided delicious fuel for the fun and hard work that made life worth living. And they still do today!
The original Wagner family at home in the 1890s. (I’m choosing to believe they were happier than this picture would indicate.)
I grew up on an 80-acre fruit farm in the coastal town of Ludington, right in the heart of Michigan’s Fruit Belt. The crops we produced supported a family of 11 and gave my mom ample ingredients to fuel the entertaining she so loved. Cocktails for 20. Dinner for 40. Dessert for 100. Mom mixed, cooked and baked up a storm, with assistance from an army of relatives, then emerged from the kitchen to serve as the life of the party. 
The Wagner homestead in 1947.
I inherited Mom’s love of entertaining as well as her recipes. This Michigan Treasures & Traditions cookbook is a tribute to her and Dad (he grew all the food!), as well as to the family and friends who have made my life richer, on and off the farm. All 233 of these recipes were tested and tasted by myself or one of the special people in my life. You’ll meet them through the recipes and stories in the book – people like my Grandma Henrietta, whose Soda Cracker Pie was a Depression-era favorite. 
The flavor of Pecan Pie, but minus the richness. (You can eat a bigger piece.)
Typical designer. Recipe cards and bookmarks coordinate nicely. I just can't help myself.
The final product will be a beautifully printed 160-page, full-color cookbook with a metal spiral binding so it lays nice and flat for simple use.
As you can see, a ton of recipes!
While Mom relied heavily on fresh fruits and vegetables harvested from the garden, she was also eminently practical. She didn’t turn her nose up at store-bought produce. She rarely rolled her own pie crusts. And easier was always better. Following her lead, the recipes in this book are simple to follow and use readily available ingredients. They’re also pretty darn delicious, if I do say so myself. I hope you enjoy preparing the food, reading the stories and making your own special memories!
Rewards. Each project sponsor at the $25 or higher level will receive one or more copies of this beautiful, collectible and amazingly useful cookbook. I strongly recommend you pledge at a level that gets you extra copies to share with friends who probably should be cooking dinner for you. They make great housewarming gifts and are also great for holiday gifting! (Spoiler alert: there’s a ton of great holiday cookie recipes in the book and more desserts than salads). I'm also including recipes cards and handy bookmarks so you can flag recipes that interest you without bending the precious pages. 
Specifications. 8.5" x 8.5" in size. 160 pages in full color, with a metal spiral binding and cardstock cover in a beautiful matte finish.
Illustrations, Designs, Photographs and Copy. I’m a graphic designer and I created the graphics and the design for this book and did most of the mouthwatering food photography after cooking or baking the recipes in my kitchen. It’s amazing I don’t weigh 500 pounds after all of that but my friends and family were extremely helpful in properly disposing of the food. They also helped me find some great old photos to help tell our Fruit Belt family story. And speaking of stories, my good friend and colleague Mike Dykstra helped me turn my stories and thoughts into the well-written copy that you’ll read in the book. After all, I’m a graphic designer. Definitely not a writer!

What people are saying
“I asked Greg if this was a low-fat cookbook. He said, ‘Yeah, the fat will sit real low on your waist.”
*****************
“The photos look good enough to eat. Yum!”
*****************
“I appreciate a cookbook that acknowledges the value of a good cocktail.”
*****************
“I’m just a bit put out because Greg’s never made the Peanut Butter Pie (page 135) for me.”
*****************
“Recipes so easy my kids can follow them – if they ever finish with their online learning.”
*****************
“I just read the cookbook cover-to-cover and discovered that 30% of the recipes are for desserts. I call that a well-balanced diet!”
*****************

Signed Copies. If you ever watch Antiques Roadshow® or Pawn Stars®, you know that signed first editions of books are where the real value is…so I’m going to personally sign each and every book that is a Kickstarter reward. In a fun colored ink. You’re welcome!
Schedule. This book is designed and written and the page files are almost complete. I’ve been working with a printer I’m very confident with so I feel safe in promising shipping in December if the project is funded. That should give you plenty of time to try some of the appetizer and drink recipes while baking several of the holiday cookie recipes included in the book before ringing in the new year!
Shipping. Kickstarter will add the cost of shipping to your pledge based on where you live.
Updates & Progress Reports. Sure thing! I’ll definitely do a couple of these so you know what’s happening with your cookbooks. But I won’t overload your inbox with a lot of annoying nonsense. I promise.
Questions. Feel free to send me questions you might have about this project. I’ll try my best to answer them and will add the good ones to the FAQ page.

campaign.story:
Annnnnd we're back with part two : Board Gamer-Isms! A hearty set of 10 vibrant and fun hard enamel pins expressing every board game addict's most commonly used sayings and little inside jokes!
I'm Michelle, I am a designer who married a board gamer, and this pin set is the result. 
If you missed part one, scroll down to the bottom to see pictures from the previous mega set of board gamer pins. If you're a previous backer, welcome back! To thank you all for your patience, I am just going to come out and give all returning backers 1 free pin! Check the FAQ for more info and thanks for coming back!
Thank you for backing this campaign!
By backing this campaign, you get:
To be FIRST to get your hands on these pins, before they're available for sale to anyone else
Access to these major bundle discounts (including a free pin for returning backers) that won't be matched after the campaign
Free stickers included with your rewards!
 Free Bonus stretch goals! (scroll down for more info) 
Pins that aren't funded during this campaign won't exist later, so thank you for giving these pins a chance!
(Give this gif a minute to load for maximum shininess!)
The Pins:
The main funding goal of $400 covers this first tier "All These Board Games" pin AND Sticker Sheet. Each additional $400 raised after that funds and unlocks another pin that you will be able to pick as a reward!


Each of these pins will be made with :
 Black Nickel metal plating
 2 pinbacks with clear rubber clutches to eliminate spinning and keep your pin secure
White, grays, and a color pop of these playful, bright colors (except for the first pin, which gets ALL the colors!) These were designed with pantone colors to ensure accuracy in manufacturing, but please note that all screens display colors a little differently. (If you bought the first set, the colors will match, plus two new colors added for this set)
Hard Enamel
If you're familiar with the last set of pins, these pins are all the same size as the "board gamer" pin, except "All these board games", which is a little big taller.
The preview images you see on this page are mockup renderings! While the real pins will be shiny and pretty, of course nothing in real life can be as perfectly flat and glossy as a digital rendering (nor can they stand up magically on their own). For a realistic idea of how the final pins will look, please see some actual photographs of the first kickstarter set at the bottom of this page.
FREEBIE Game-Weight Stickers:
5 stickers will be unlocked alongside the pins in the campaign and included for FREE according to your reward level! They will be sturdy, glossy stickers, 2.5 in. tall, on heavy duty vinyl. 

Sticker Sheet:
This 5x7 inch sticker sheet is unlocked from the get-go and includes sticker versions of all of the 10 pin designs. These individual stickers are ~1.5 in. tall, the same size as their pin brethren. (You'll also be able to add these to your reward later in the survey if you want.)
Edit: I realize I left out the sticker sheet as a listed item in the top tier $85 10 pin reward slot but listed it in the description. I cannot edit the reward now that the campaign is running, but just to be clear, backers of this 10-pin reward tier WILL get the sticker sheet AND all 5 game weight stickers!

Bonus Stretch Goal Freebies!
You have all gone above and beyond what I expected for this kickstarter, so here’s more FREE STUFF!! Magnets are free to ALL pin backers (everyone who has backed for at least 1 pin reward) and will automatically be added to your reward. Keychains are free and automatically added to all backers of AT LEAST 6 pins. If we get all the way to $9000, everyone who has backed at least 1 pin will get a free embroidered patch! These are cumulative, so if we make it to $9000 you’ll get all of these extra stretch goal items for which you are eligible!
All of these extra stretch goals that we unlock will be available as ADD-ONS in the backerkit survey, so even if you backed for the sticker-only rewards and aren’t eligible to get a keychain for free, you can still get one for $10 USD plus shipping (or a patch or magnet for $5 USD) and shipped with your other rewards.
A flexible magnet perfect for your refrigerator or other magnetic surface! 

Slightly smaller than the pins themselves (so it won’t be too clunky if it’s on your keys).
Same width as the “all these board games” magnet.

I do not have a realistic looking preview of how this patch will look when embroidered with thread, so you’ll have to use your imagination. It may look slightly different than this mock up, as the edges will be sewn, but I’m confident it’s going to end up looking hella cool. It will include 11 colors of thread and I’m very excited to see it!
Add-Ons
I get lots of questions about add-ons (which you can also read about in the FAQ) but here's some basic info to help familiarize you with what you can do to get more stuff in addition to your pledged campaign reward, that'll be shipped at the same time as your pledge reward.
You can either wait for the backerkit survey after the campaign to purchase these items, or you may want to add the extra amount to your pledge NOW in your campaign pledge manager. That way you'll get charged the extra amount at the same time as you are charged for your main kickstarter pledge and the credit will be waiting for you so you can select extra pins and stickers in the backerkit survey and not be charged a second time. This will also avoid any extra transaction fees from a second transaction.
Cool, so some of the things you'll be able to add-on:
The previous campaign's 15 pin set "Board Game Genres" will all be available to purchase for $11 USD per pin
The previous campaign's 2.5 in. stickers (ask me about my kallax, first player, rules lawyer, less AP more VP) will be available for $3 USD per sticker
The previous campaign's sticker sheet of 15 game genre stickers will be available for $5 USD per sheet
THIS CAMPAIGN's freebie game weight stickers will be available for $3 USD per sticker
THIS CAMPAIGN's sticker sheet will be available for $5 USD per sheet
My "Dragon's D20" enamel pin (view on my site if you're curious!)
All additional unlocked Stretch Goal items from this campaign (keychains for $10 USD, magnets for $5 USD, and patch for $5 USD)

Timeline
All of the design files have been finalized and approved and quoted by my manufacturing partner, who brought the last gorgeous set to life. Here's how I expect the next few months to go, barring any additional craziness in the world:
October: This campaign will be live
November: Surveys sent out
Mid-November: Funds received, pins and stickers begin manufacturing
January: Completed pins and stickers shipped to me and I begin checking them for quality and packaging them up for you
Late January-February: Rewards sent out!
(A note on international shipping: I am planning to use USPS First Class International Package service to save you all some cash, but it may take the pins weeks longer to reach you. During the last campaign, some people had significant postal system and customs delays. So, while you should expect between 7-21 days, there may be delays beyond this time frame. If you are an international backer and would like faster shipping, you can ADD $12 USD to your pledge, and I will ship your package USPS Priority, which should arrive in about a week. This option will also be available in the backerkit.)
Funding Breakdown
Of the initial $400 funding goal - covering the "All These Board Games" pin and sticker sheet - the budget breaks down as follows:
70% Manufacturing costs for pins and stickers
20% Shipping costs
5-10% Kickstarter Fees
The FINAL first set of board gamer pins from the first kickstarter
The FINAL first set of board gamer pins and stickers from the first kickstarter
The best way to be sure that your favorite pin gets unlocked is to share this campaign with all of your board game night regulars! You can find posts to share on my instagram and twitter pages @polliadesign (and also a lot of other sketches, dice, and fun designs, if you feel like browsing!)
Thank you so much for supporting this campaign, these pins can't make it off the sketchbook page without each and every one of you!

campaign.story:
"Tarot—much like Troika itself—is about interpretation, personal experience, and instinct. There is a framework, a set of agreed-upon rules for experiencing it, but ultimately the bulk of the application is left up to the players. This parallel between Troika and tarot felt interesting, so I began looking at how cards could be interpreted into Backgrounds."
Articles of the Arcana is a tarot-inspired supplement for Troika, the other world's favorite RPG, created by the Melsonian Arts Council. It is a collection of new character options, devious enemies, and a tarot-themed campaign setting, all accompanied by dozens of pieces of beautiful art crafted by an amazing array of artists. In addition, we are creating a physical tarot deck to use with the book or as a stand-alone divination tool. 
Troika is a tabletop roleplaying game that focuses on telling awesome stories without getting bogged down in rules. This meshes perfectly with tarot, which encourages you to interpret and impart meaning onto the game, not be confined or dictated by it. If you're looking for a game that will let you tell amazing stories, Troika is for you. For a quick primer on Troika, we recommend checking out the official Troika website.
If you don't already own a copy of Troika! Numinous Edition, you can get a digital copy during this campaign over 50% off; check the Rewards section below for more info. 
In addition to providing backers with amazing rewards, we are committed to making gaming more accessible to those experiencing financial hardship. For every digital or physical copy of Articles of the Arcana pledged for during this campaign, a free digital community copy will be made available on Itch. Gaming is for everyone. 
Articles of the Arcana is a beautifully illustrated book to add to your Troika collection, either digitally or physically. The cover is illustrated and designed by the talented Ignacio Paul and features subtle and not-so-subtle imagery inspired by tarot. This cover perfectly sums up the awe and splendor of the contents within. The physical book will be an A5 matte softcover, full color throughout, featuring 72 pages of content and art. 
Mock up of softcover book design.
The book contains 36 new character backgrounds each inspired by a card in the tarot, including the entire Major Arcana. You'll also find new skills and spells for your character to utilize, fantastical enemies to challenge them, and 22 campaign prompts, each representing a part of the journey described in the Major Arcana. It has everything you need to tarot your Troika in style.
Each background is accompanied by tarot cards illustrated by Alex Perkins, Bri de Danann, Matthew Cartwright, and Thérèse Lanz. The book is rounded out with a collection of new enemies and a playable adventure and world-building advice, featuring art from Alec Sorensen and Amanda Franck.
Preview of The Fool and The Magician Backgrounds.
Whether you are here to add to your bookshelf, digital collection, or to put amazing art on your walls, we have a pledge level that is sure to suit your tastes. To start, choose one of the following pledges: 
 $15 - Digital Book (PDF) : For those looking to game without all the clutter, this reward is for you. You get all the art and content in a convenient digital format. If you are new to Troika, choose the $20 - Digital + Troika pledge to also receive a digital copy of Troika! Numinous Edition for over 50% off. 
 $20 - Tarot Deck Only : You may be here for the tarot deck and nothing more, and to you we say "absolutely!" You will receive a purchase code for an at-cost print-on-demand tarot deck. The deck includes the 36 cards from the book and automatically upgrades to a full 78-card deck if we reach $6,000 in funding.
 $25 - Softcover + Digital Book : The book in stunning full-color softcover glory. You also get a digital copy.  If you are new to Troika, choose the $30 - Softcover + Digital + Troika pledge to also receive a digital copy of Troika! Numinous Edition for over 50% off. 
 $45 - Softcover + Digital + Tarot : For those who want the full tarot experience, this is the reward for you. In addition to your physical and digital books, you will also receive a purchase code for an at-cost print-on-demand tarot deck. The deck includes the 36 cards from the book and automatically upgrades to a full 78-card deck if we reach $6,000 in funding. If you are new to Troika, choose the $50 - Softcover + Digital + Tarot + Troika pledge to also receive a digital copy of Troika! Numinous Edition for over 50% off.
Mock up of physical tarot box and cards.
Shipping for physical orders will be collected after the project successfully funds through Backerkit. This allows us to offer a more realistic rate at the time of shipping rather than charging you a rough estimate now. You'll also be able to use Backerkit to make any last-minute additions to your rewards if you change your mind later. Backerkit uses Stripe to process payments, please ensure your country is supported before committing to a pledge. We are sorry if your country is not supported by Stripe.
For those who want to upgrade or customize their rewards, we have several add ons for your consideration. We are also using the Kickstarter beta features for add ons to improve and simplify your experience. Here's what you can add to any pledge level:
 $10 - Art Print : Add one 5x7 print of your choice. 
 $20 - Tarot Deck : Add a purchase code for an at-cost print-on-demand tarot deck. The deck includes the 36 cards from the book and automatically upgrades to a full 78-card deck if we reach $6,000 in funding.  
 $40 - Print Pack : Add five 5x7 prints of your choice for the price of four! 
The first five print options will be the book cover (without text) by Ignacio Paul, The Fool by Bri de Danann, The Magician by Alex Perkins, The Lovers by Thérèse "Trez" Lanz, and The Hanged Man by Matthew Cartwright. Art will be printed on white, uncoated, smooth 130# cover weight paper, perfect for any presentation. Full previews are posted in Update 1.  
Five initial tarot card print options.
If you are a retailer and would like to make a large order of books for your store, shop, site, roadside stand, or traveling caravan, please send me a message so we can discuss wholesale rates. 
We think the project is pretty great as it is, but we have some improvements in mind that we can offer if we raise funds above the initial goal of $4,500. 
FUNDED! $4,500 - Funded : We will create art, both physically and metaphorically. This allows us to fund the rest of the art needed for the book as well as manufacture amazing books and art prints. Thank you!
UNLOCKED! $6,000 - Full Tarot Deck : At this point, we will be able to fund the creation of an entire 72 card tarot deck's worth of art. All physical deck rewards are automatically upgraded from a 36-card deck to a 78-card deck. 
UNLOCKED! $7,000 - Artist Rate Increase : We'll offer four additional print options for you to choose from, as well as an additional reward to get all nine prints for $70 (buy 7 get 2 free!). We will also be increasing the artists' rate by $50 each.
$9,000 - Hardcover Book Option : Maybe softcover isn't your thing, and that's OK. If we get to this level, we'll be offering a hardcover version with a special edition cover for $35. You can upgrade your book to hardcover or add one to your pledge to get both. 
Matthew Gravelyn (he/him) - Writer/Designer: Matthew is a game design and writer who focuses on approachable, story-driven experiences and finding joy in the mundane. This is a radical departure from that last part, making his debut contribution to Troika with a weird and wonderful tarot-inspired book. When not engaged with games, Matthew can be found paddle boarding, beach combing with his family, and watching TV in bed with his wife. You can find more of Matthew's work at mr-matthew.itch.io or on Twitter @mrmatthew.
Ignacio Paul (he/him) - Cover Artist: Ignacio is an artist who is dedicated to illustration and cover design. He likes to create worlds to experience surrealism and fantasy topics in his own style . Ignacio is always trying to go beyond the first impression and explore the worlds of every project. You can find more of Ignacio's work at nachoandrespaul.myportfolio.com and on Twitter @IgnacioAPaul.
Alex Perkins (she/they) - Background Artist: Alex is a biracial freelance illustrator from small-town Wisconsin who is currently based in Chicago. She received her BFA in Illustration from the Minneapolis College of Art & Design. Her colorful work explores vibrant fantastical settings, women loving women, and what it means to be human. She enjoys writing her own D&D campaign, learning new things, and showering her dog in unearned praise. To see more of their work, check out @alexpperkins on Twitter, Instagram, and Tumblr, or on their website alexpperkins.com. 
Bri de Danann (she/her)  - Background Artist: Bri is an illustrator and comic artist working in the Comic and Board Game industry. She is best known for her work on The Phoenix, a science fiction adventure comic, and Elemental Spark, a fantasy brawl board game released in August 2020. She primarily works in the digital medium, bringing other worldly characters and landscapes to life via her bright, dynamic style. Bri has a huge fondness for Tarot and Roleplaying games, so melding the two with Articles of Arcana is a dream come true. You can find more of Bri's work on bridedanann.com, twitch.tv/BriDanann, and on Twitter @BriDanann.
Matthew Cartwright (he/him) - Background Artist: Matthew is an illustrator, concept artist, and plant dad heavily influenced by science fiction and fantasy. He uses both traditional and digital mediums to explore and shape extraordinary new worlds. Matthew has worked with a number of independent creators and loves to collaborate with and contribute to the TTRPG community. You can find more of Matthew’s work on his website mattcartwrightillustration.com, Artstation, Twitter, and Instagram.
Thérèse "Trez" Lanz (she/her) - Background Artist: Trez is a game developer and artist turned freelance fantasy illustrator. She has a love of warriors, wizards, and spooky forests. You can find more of her work on Twitter @GameResTrez or check out their game art portfolio at artstation.com/trez_art.
Alec Sorensen (he/him) - Campaign Artist: Alec is a writer and illustrator who is gently obsessed with all things haunted, bittersweet, and (ideally) involving skulls. He has previously illustrated Electric Bastionland and The Stygian Library, and, when not hunched over his desk catching up on work, can be found replaying Hollow Knight for the 4th time and assigning each character a Tarot card. You can find more of Alec’s work at behance.net/alecsorensen, and on his Twitter or Instagram.
Amanda Lee Franck (she/her) - Enemy Artist: Amanda is an illustrator and game designer working in Chicago.  She's illustrated for Codex Zine, written for Trophy: Gold, and both for You Got a Job on the Garbage Barge.  She's currently working on a podcast called The Chicago Department of Alley Evaluations and trying to draw a haunted house for every day of October. You can find more of her work at afranck.myportfolio.com and on Instagram. 
Jon Boyle (he/they) - Editor: Jonathon is a lifelong bookworm and teacher-turned-writer with a deep love of tabletop games and storytelling. He works primarily as an editor for comics, games, and prose, helping creators find the right words to give shape to their ideas. Troika and Tarot sit squarely in Jon’s love for the mysterious and otherworldly, so he’s thrilled to see the two intermingled. When he’s not writing, you can find Jon cooking, drawing, and serenading his utterly unenthused cat with 2000s pop-punk. You can find more of Jon’s work at residentbard.com and on Twitter @residentbard.
The Finances
Here is a look at the costs of this project based on the funding goal of $4,500:
 $2,100 - Art : The biggest cost is all that beautiful art. Tarot is a visual experience and needed to be done properly by some very talented artists. 
 $1,200 - Printing : This money will be used to convert the digital files into physical artifacts, including a 72-page full-color softcover book and 5x7 art prints.
 $800 - Fees : This covers Kickstarter's fees, credit card processing fees, and setup fees for Backerkit. Everyone gets their cut.
 $400 - Buffer : Even though I've spent days working on a budget, contacting manufacturing partners, and working out rates with artists, there's always a chance something changes. This money will be used for any unforeseen costs.

updates.update_content: Hello everyone! This is just a quick reminder update to please fill out your surveys! All surveys are now sent through BackerKit, so if you haven't seen an invite email (spam, trash, junk, whatever, check all your folders!) please send me a message and I can help you out. My plan is to lock down surveys this weekend so I can get an accurate count of books and decks I need to order. Not filling out your survey in time may result in delayed shipping, higher costs, or missing rewards. PLEASE don't let that happen!

Hello backers! Today is a huge update: the book is finished! I wrote the final words this morning and have been recovering ever since. I have also launched the digital copy on Itch so I can sneak it into the current Troikafest Jam that's going on, if you'd like to check that out. Below are some updates regarding the next steps in fulfilling the rewards. 
Digital Books on Itch

The testing on BackerKit went really well, so we're ready to open up surveys for everyone! Check your email for a direct link to your survey, of visit https://articles-arcana.backerkit.com and enter your Kickstarter email address to find your survey. 
The surveys will be open for a couple weeks to give everyone a chance to finish and also allow folks who missed the project to preorder books and decks if they want. When it's time to lock down surveys, you'll get a notice and your cards will be charged for shipping and any addons.

Hello folks! As promised I have been hard at work getting the BackerKit surveys all set up. That whole process is finally done and we will begin sending out the "smoke test" invites in the next couple days. This will be an invite sent to only 5% of backers spread across the different tiers to make sure everything was set up correctly. If they find any issues, I can have a chance to fix them. Once everything is confirmed to be working as expected, the rest of the surveys invites will go out, likely early next week.

Hello everyone! We have a very important mid-month update for you all, so lets dive right into it with a quick overview:
ALL ART IS DONE! The cards, the backgrounds, and the campaign prompts art is all turned in and it is gorgeous!
TAROT DECK IS DONE! I have already received a sample of the deck. It is looking really good and I have some photos below for you. 
Tarot deck ordering and fulfillment has changed! Read more below.

Hello everyone! Another month of work has come to a close and we are getting so close to finishing the content creation portion of our work we can smell it! Below are updates around the BackerKit surveys and a tease of recent card art, for those interested. 
Here's the high-level update:
36 of 36 background cards are done! We're also cruising toward finishing the entire deck, with 57 of 78 cards completed. We also did a little bit of retooling around the graphic design on the cards to make the deck feel more cohesive and easy to read on the fly. We're really excited about it!

campaign.story:
Welcome, one and all, to the reboot of the decade. The Normal Tarot 2: Actual Vengeance This Time, Maybe. Last year, we launched the Normal Tarot 2: Revenge Kickstarter. At the time, I was trying to be realistic with a low goal, with the goal of funding the deck in parts over time. Then people backed the hell out of it and we funded with over 2x the amount we needed to get the deck made. It was awesome. We ran out of extra decks almost immediately, and created a print on demand version that was just less cool. It didn't have silver gilded edges, and it didn't come in a box.
This time, the original deck by Amy Smith is back with a darker take, silver foil, better gilding, and a cooler box, and it's not alone!
Introducing the Normal Tarot 2: Actually #2 This Time. A black deck with white details, gold foil, and gold trim. For this deck, the artist from Furiously Prognosticating and the cover of the previous tarot book is doing the deck, and the deck artist from last time is doing the new book's cover. We thought it might be fun to switch things around.
That gives us TWO unique takes on the Normal Tarot design in one Kickstarter. No matter which one you pledge for, you are going to get a gorgeous deck with foil designs, gilded edges, and a lovely box! Do you want Amy's Silver, or Sam's Gold? Both? With or without a guidebook? Because no one on this campaign is getting a bland deck, I can assure you of that!

 The Deck(s)
The Normal Tarot is a not-so-normal tarot deck created by the one and only Caretaker of Normal Horoscopes fame. If you aren't familiar with them, go read up on their blog. They post horoscopes, answer people's asks, give fortunes, research magic, demonology, and create incredibly unique tarot decks.
The deck features 99 cards, with a replaced major arcana (6 books, 8 moons, 7 kings, several wild cards, & 5 jokers) and suits replaced with seasons, featuring 3 knights and 3 queens (Lady, Queen, Mother) each. You can see 3 card readings and many of the cards on their blog here.
The Caretaker is also updating the guidebook, and each will have the same guidebook, just with different cover art and the different deck's card arts on its pages.
The Silver version is the original, now with silver foil designs on the fronts. It comes with silver gilded edges and a silver foil pressed, two piece card box to keep the cards safe on a high quality black core card stock. Illustrated by the incredible Amy Smith.
The complete silver tarot, over half updated! Blue is where the silver foil will be!

The Gold version is #2, with gold foil designs on the fronts. It comes with gold gilded edges and a gold foil pressed, two piece card box to keep the cards safe on a high quality black core card stock. Illustrated by the incredible Samantha Dow, Charmingly Antiquated on tumblr, and runner of Elsewhere University.
The entire Gold Tarot
Reward Tiers
If you get here early, you can grab the early bird specials to save 10$. I know that for many right now money is tight due to Covid and otherwise. Please leave the early bird tiers if you can afford to pay for the main tiers.
Otherwise it's $40 for a deck, $50 for a deck and book combo, and $90 to get both decks with both books, or $110 to get both decks with both books AND a set of the Publishing Goblin's Oracle Dice and book. Any tier that gets a deck or oracle dice gets a PDF of the guidebook!
Retailers can grab 5 copies of either deck with book for $125, but they must contact me before pledging and clear what their store is/make sure they actually have a store. 
Add Ons
We are lucky to be one of the first campaigns trying out the new integrated add ons for Kickstarter, and are we going to use it!
Add on an extra Deck of either for $40, or Deck and book for $50.
Add on a 5x7 foil postcard for $10.
Pins add on for $8 per pin.
Stickers at $4 a sticker.
Publishing Goblin's Oracle Dice & Book for $25.


Check out their kickstarter now!
F(r)iction's issues are full of incredible stories and art, and the covers are all shiny and holographic!

Who We Are
The Original Designer, Occultist, Demonologist, Fortune Giver, and Diviner: The Caretaker! They are a skeleton who lives in California with their charges, literal star children, preparing them to enter the sky on behalf of their mad goddess. They run Normal Horoscopes, designed the Normal Tarot (and did all the write ups in the books!) and just are really fucking cool. Follow them on tumblr or twitter, and ask for a fortune! Make sure you offer something in return, though. And don't type in all caps, that's their thing. It's rude to yell.
Find them at Tumblr:   @normal-horoscopes       Twitter: @normalhoroscope
The Baron of the Ocean, a Sailor of Historic Wooden Schooners, and an Incredible Artist: Samantha Dow!  Samantha Dow is just a badass, she writes, illustrates, and sails boats. She has made some comics on tumblr you might have seen, and runs Elsewhere University, a blog with dozens of reference materials and posts that rides the line between rp and a fae university full of strangeness. Sam illustrated our first joint book, Furiously Prognosticating, and the cover for my oracle dice, as well as the first Tarot's cover, and is now illustrating the full new Normal Tarot gold deck.
Find her at IG: @charm_illustrations     Tumblr: @CharminglyAntiquated    Twitter: @CharminglySam
Hailing from the Ugly Melon, Pretty Lemon land of Strangeness, Accomplished Artist and Designer: We have the illustrious Amy Smith! Amy is a graphic designer who took up drawing the original cycle of Normal Tarot for fun off of Caretaker's descriptions. What began as an exercise soon turned into a payday as we grabbed her up to illustrate the full deck. She has done some fantastic design work for me personally outside of these joint projects, and will be doing the cover for this tarot set's book, swapping roles with Sam, as well as updating her original run of the Tarot for silver foil!
Find her at IG:  @iwilldrawforfood       Tumblr: @uglymelon      Twitter: @willdrawforfood
And, Publisher, Editor, Campaign Runner, Shipper, Back End Goblin: I'm Seven Dane Asmund, also known as the Publishing Goblin. I make and run the Kickstarters, put the stuff together to make it make-able, edit, handle the business garbage, like finding good printers, entering price talks, etc. I handle the spread sheets, the actual work of packing and shipping, and contracts. I'm also the one you talk to on these Kickstarters! So say hi to your local Publishing Goblin. They work hard to make the things happen so you can hold them!
Find them at Tumblr:  @publishinggoblin     Twitter: @daneasmund  IG: @SevenThirteenBooks
Promoted by Backerkit

If we don't, we will relaunch with a smaller goal just to fund the new Gold deck, and to pay Amy for the work she's done on this Kickstarter's images and updating the original deck, and try to fund the silver one in another kickstarter later on.

updates.update_userinfo: Is it finally that time? I think so.
updates.update_content:
Hello all you amazing people. First off, my apologies for not updating sooner.

However, every time I got new info, I was happy to share it! And share it I did, only for it to be wrong again, again, and again. The printer repeatedly either lied to me or was just mistaken with their estimated dates, so I kept passing on new, later dates to you. Not even June 2nd was right, it appears.

Hello everyone,

The wait is ALMOST OVER. The fulfillment center has (almost) everything at this point but the decks themselves, which have been on a freighter the past 20~ days, and should arrive by June 2nd. I wanted to save an update until I had confirmation that the decks had arrived so I could let you all know that the fulfillment was starting, but I've been getting some (very fairly) impatient messages asking what's going on.

updates.update_userinfo: NEWS! NEWS AT LAST!! AND THE GOLD TAROT!!
updates.update_content: Okay, I finally heard that starting next week, the Gold tarot and the Silver tarot will be leaving the printer and are on their way to the Fulfillment Center!!!! That means... we probably still have a month or so to wait for them to arrive... BUT STILL! It's finally some concrete news.  So they should arrive in like the middle/end of May, and start shipping then and into June, so about what I estimated last update. I'm so ready. That also means that I am going to be locking pre-orders and additional add ons and addresses here in the next few weeks. Be sure to update them in the survey you originally filled out if you need to on backerkit! : )
Today I got my production samples of the silver Normal Tarot, and they all look so incredibly good!

Have you ever wished you could eat your own words?
Tl;dr: Fulfillment is pushed back a month. Will start mid April, may last into first week of May.
Unfortunately the update from the printer today, as I promised, is not a great one. Though they told me a while back before the Lunar New Year break that the Silver deck was at least in production, they're now telling me that both decks were put on hold over the break. The printers were worried that with the size of the job and the foil printing that needed properly mounted that if they started, stopped for the holiday, then came back to it, it could get off-set.

So, everything is still happening! : )
Sorry for the radio silence, I was planning to give it a month and reach out in a couple more days, but there's apparently a function in Kickstarter that lets people request an update. I think that's kind of incredible and now I want to go look at it for all the old Kickstarters I supported haha!

campaign.story:
A beautiful book of over 100 recipes exploring the flavours of alcohol.
We've written and photographed over 100 recipes where alcohol is the main ingredient, and we can't wait to share them with you! 

Hardcover recipe book
Over 100 savoury & sweet recipes
Every single one with alcohol as a key ingredient
Every single one with a beautiful photo 
Recipes for both meat eaters and vegetarians

Alcoholic drinks are some of the most delicious items in our homes, brewed or distilled primarily for flavour, and we believe that this gives them tremendous power as ingredients in the kitchen. Packed with flavour, and with a chemical structure that impacts a recipe beyond the taste, the alcohol shelf provides an intriguing variety of ingredients for the home cook to explore.

Discover recipes like Mojito Chicken, Fennel & White Wine Tagliatelle, Tequila & Habañero Salmon, Salted Caramel and Spiced Rum Brownies, Amaretto and Ginger Cheesecake, or make your own Cider Mustard!
Tequila & Habañero Salmon with Salsa Fresca and Black Beans
This book isn’t full of luxury foods, and it isn’t about consuming large amounts of alcohol. The focus is on finding enjoyment through sharing innovative and delicious food with loved ones, whether that’s midweek Sticky Cider Sausages with Mustard Mash or treating your friends to a plateful of Coconut Rum and Raspberry Cupcakes. We've made sure there are plenty of recipes for meat eaters and vegetarians alike.

Good food shouldn't take all night to cook! This book contains a balance of easy recipes for a weeknight dinner (like Port Pesto with Rigatoni, or Cheddar & Stout Risotto) with more extravagant dishes that take a bit longer (like our delicious Beer & Baileys Doughnuts). 
Sticky Cider Sausages with Mustard Mash, and Cheddar & Stout Risotto

We're so excited to be working with hybrid publisher Lendal Press, an imprint of Valley Press, to publish this book in April 2021. We need your help to show that that there's a market for this book that we love and believe in so much, and to contribute to the costs of the first print run (more details below).

Chapters
 The chapters in the book are:
Starters & Small Plates
Mains
Side Dishes
Desserts
Savoury Baking
Sweet Baking
  There will be two indexes at the back - one alphabetical, and one by alcohol. There will also be a page at the back with the names of our amazing Kickstarter backers!
Chicken with Brandy & Apricots and Tequila Key Lime Pie (aka Te-key-lime Pie)


 What will this book look like? 
Cooking with Alcohol will be a hardcover book, size 7" x 10" (18cm x 25cm), with no dust jacket. Each recipe will have a photograph, so you know what you're cooking! We all know that if a recipe doesn't have a photo, there's no chance we'll cook it.
The pages will be high quality paper with a matte coating to prevent glare on the recipes as you cook. There will be 200-240 pages in total. 
Cover design yet to be confirmed.
About the authors
We are Aaron and Susannah Rickard - two friendly people in our late twenties, based in Bath in the south west of England. We are not professional cooks, but cooking is well and truly our passion! 

This book has been developed in our kitchen over the last four years. It began as a dinner with friends, themed on alcohol food. When thinking up recipes to cook for the dinner, the possibilities with alcohol seemed endless and we could hardly decide what to make! With so many ideas, we began testing recipes at home for ourselves. All of the recipes in Cooking with Alcohol have been tested (multiple times), written and photographed in our flat.

Susannah is in the international business team for a herbal tea company. Australian-born and now UK-based, she spent a number of years working for a recipe kit company (The Spicery in Bristol), including writing and testing hundreds of recipes in the development kitchen. This expertise ensures that Cooking with Alcohol is clearly written, with thorough instructions designed for the home cook.
Aaron is a web developer in London and a keen food photographer. With American heritage and a multicultural upbringing he's a fan of food from all over the world. As well as creating recipes, Aaron brings the technical and editing expertise to our photography & the beautiful typesetting of the pages.
Sloe Gin & Blackberry Cobbler and Salted Caramel Spiced Rum Brownies
We both have a love for other cultures, and this has greatly influenced our cooking style. For example, recipes such as our Bourbon Brined Beef Short Ribs are influenced by Aaron's love of Texas BBQ, while Chorizo in Red Wine and Honey is inspired by a dish that we loved in Barcelona.
We’re fascinated by using new techniques and learning the science behind the food. In Cooking with Alcohol we share the science of how alcohol changes food, and we use innovative techniques when they are relevant - you'll find this in our Red Wine Focaccia and our vegan Alcoholic Chocolate Mousse (made with any alcohol for infinite variations), among others. 

There are so many wonderful ways that alcohol can impact flavour and cooking techniques and bring something truly special to the table!

See what’s cooking at @rickardkitchen, or sign up to the mailing list on our website. The talented @hellonickyg created the book visualisations. 
Six varieties of Alcoholic Chocolate Mousse
How far along is the project?
Far! 

All the recipes have been written and tested and 90% have been photographed. Our recipe testers (also called friends) are busy testing what recipes they can to gather as much extra feedback as possible.
We will be making edits with Lendal Press during October & November, and working on cover design & other details during December. 
Providing that the funding target has been met, the first print run will take place in February 2021. The publication date is expected to be April 2021. We cant wait!

 Why are you crowdfunding for this book? 
This is our first book. We are delighted to have found a great publisher to work with (Lendal Press, an imprint of Valley Press) and signed a contract with them for Cooking with Alcohol. As Lendal are a small independent publisher, they work on a hybrid publishing model - this means that we need to raise half of the costs of the first print run through crowdfunding. This proves that the book has a market and reduces the financial risk on a small publishing house. Visit their websites to read more about Lendal Press and Valley Press, and the hybrid publishing model.
The fundraising target (£4200) will cover 50% of the costs of the first print run. Once the Kickstarter has been fully funded we'll be able to finalise the publication date and initiate the first print run. 
Salted Caramel & Spiced Rum Brownies
Mushroom & Stout Pasties and White Wine Pound Cake
Chicken, Amaretto & Saffron Biryani
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is a low risk project: we have already signed a contract with Lendal Press to publish this book. With a publisher secured it's one of the most substantial hurdles passed that many books face. 

All the recipes have been written and tested and 90% have been photographed.

We expect to be making edits with Lendal Press during October & November, and working on cover design & other details during December. 

Providing that the funding target has been met, the first print run will take place in January 2021. The publication date is expected to be April 2021.

There is a risk that coronavirus outbreak or lockdown could delay printing or publication, as with every project right now. In the case that this does happen (we certainly hope it doesn't!) you'll still receive your e-book on schedule.

Animated Intro by Starr - @HammDoodles. Thank you Starr!! <3 Please watch the video above!
Update: READ A SHORT PREQUEL COMIC  HERE
Update 2: Funded!!! <3 I love you all so much!
The Story
Rei, or, Reille Arsen DeRovio Akelli used to be the Second Prince of Astye. After his recent banishment, Rei turned to petty crime to survive, getting involved with a gang of thieves. However, once the gang discovers he’s an ex-prince with a bounty on his head, they turn on him, planning to trade him for the reward money.
Waldon Max is a simple florist, a widower, and a single father. One day, Rei suddenly breaks into his shop, claiming to have escaped a gang chasing him. Haunted by his dark past, Waldon initially tries to attack the intruder, only to realize his mistake and apologize. He offers Rei shelter from the gang in exchange for helping around the shop after his young daughter takes a liking to Rei. Despite being nervous that his royal origins and the bounty on his head will catch up to him again, Rei accepts.
However, as Rei and Waldon fall into a comfortable routine managing the flower shop, Rei’s secret past isn’t the only thing keeping a wall between them; there’s a mysterious shadow following them around town, and Waldon isn’t surprised by it. Fearing for their safety, Rei demands answers, but the florist ends up giving him a request instead: asking for help in taking down this mysterious figure who's been haunting Waldon for years.
As the attraction between them is heightened by the threat of danger, Rei and Waldon must fight the demons of their pasts- together.
The Book 
The Fox and the Fallen Prince (80,000 words) is a Romance/Fantasy title with alternating perspectives between Rei and Waldon. Despite the amount of art on this page, it is a prose book, although we have a stretch goal of insert illustrations and I have drawn header images for each chapter. The book is New Adult but with a much lighter and more humorous tone like those found in YA. Although there's nothing explicit, there is a fair bit of innuendo and swearing, so I would rate it 18+ to be safe. Content and Trigger warnings will be at the bottom of this page!
Rei is trans and gay, Waldon is bi, one of the main antagonists is nonbinary, and most of the cast is LGBT in some way. As a lesbian, I really like to see stories about my community set in fun fictional settings that they aren’t commonly seen in. I have also had several nonbinary and trans sensitivity readers to make sure my portrayal of those identities is accurate.
This book is the first in a five-book series that centers on self-improvement and forgiveness. I have all five fully outlined, and am currently writing book two.
The first chapter of this book will be posted in the updates tab! I encourage you to read it before pledging :D
 Why Kickstarter?
I've tried querying the book a couple of times, and the traditional publishing world is definitely becoming more open to LGBT projects, but I don't think they're quite ready yet for an (admittedly weird) story like this one. I would rather get the book to the people it was written for as soon as possible, which would be you! This book is very special to me and I hope that you all will love it as much as I do.
I do plan on eventually putting the book up on Kindle after the campaign, but getting your name on the 'Thank You Backers" page will remain Kickstarter exclusive and be printed in all future copies.
 The Rewards
The book!! 6x9 softcover of around 250 pages.
Book Cover by Irene - @CrowLaDee
Lettering on the Cover by Hanna - @Hanna.font
Pride Miniprint by Julian - @FainFaineant
Pattern Bookmark by Lizzy - @LizzyItzkowitz
Stickers by Mar - @MarshMallorca
The "Signed and Doodled in" tier will include my signature and a doodle of one of the characters.
The 'Fox' Goodies tier will include the bookmark, miniprint, and both stickers.
The 'Book 2 Preview' tier will include the prologue and chapter 1 of Book 2, with the working title 'The Palace of Ice and Ivory.'
The 'Prince' tier includes getting your name, or a name of your choosing, into the book as a side character. The flower shop has several regular customers that appear throughout the book, that could be you! After the Kickstarter I will reach out to you so we can pick a name :D
Budgeting
All shipping will be charged through BackerKit after the campaign has ended. This is to allow for more accurate shipping prices and to allow people to purchase additional items after the campaign. The current estimate is $7 for North America (USA, Canada, Mexico) and $18 for everywhere else.
In addition to paying for printing, merch, and paying artists, it's very important to me to pay for a professional line editing. This will make sure there are no grammar or punctuation mistakes in the final draft, as well as improve the overall quality.
Stretch Goals
$3,000 - Fully Funded! I will be super grateful that the book is happening!
$3,750 - Each artist will get an increase in pay!
$4,000 - An additional short story starring Rei and Scarlet will be added to the book!
$4,100 - 5,000 - For every $100 above $4,000, Irene will do an insert illustration for a scene in the book. Max: 10.
Reviews
"The Fox and the Fallen Prince is a thoroughly fun ride from start to finish. With fast-paced scenes and hilarious dialogue, it’s almost impossible to put this book down. With characters so real you feel like you know them, wonderful LQBTQ+ rep, insanely charismatic antagonists, and a love story that is classic and fresh in all the right ways, The Fox and the Fallen Prince is an unforgettable story." - Katje
"This story, beyond its mysteries, wit, and drama, is incredibly charmingly warm. It shines a comforting light on the small moments in life and never forgets that the antagonists are human too." - Julian
"An immensely beautiful book, full of mysteries, excitement, and love." - Alyssa
Thank You!
Thank you for reading this whole thing and for taking an interest in my boys :') They're very important to me and I'm so excited to share their story with you. Thank you to anyone who pledges or spreads the word!
Content and Trigger Warnings
Beware of spoilers! But included for those who want to make sure they're comfortable <3
CWs: Spousal death, gender dysphoria, descriptions of minor blood and gore (nothing too crazy or gross-out on purpose,) alcohol/ drinking scenes are common, minor bit of abuse, weapons (guns, daggers, crossbows, swords, poisons,) pain medication, kidnapping.
campaign.risks:

I ran a successful fanzine out of my school dorm a couple years ago, which required mailing 500 packages. I have experience managing and shipping out of my home, so that shouldn't be a problem. Still, I've never run an actual kickstarter before, so it will be a learning experience for me.
If we don't get funded, it will take me a while to pay the artists myself, but I WILL pay them. I hope that won't happen though!

We all know that there are dark days, bad times, sorrows and sufferings which, however unbearable they may be, will not last forever. However, when the heart bleeds and becomes so heavy that our legs can no longer carry us, sometimes we forget it. Then you collapse in the dark, alone like drifting dust in the universe.
I created the Mornes Plaines of Arcanya to help those who go through life's trials not to forget it, and to remember that even in the darkest moments, each of us has an infinite source of light, and unsuspected resources to rise again, stronger and greater than we were before.
The world of Arcanya seems hopelessly lost. This is a kingdom where the abyss buries every living thing. The 4 elements, Earth (the Pentacles), Air (the Swords), Water (the Cups) and Fire (the Wands) have given way to Stones, Wind, Rain and Ashes.
Yet it is a kingdom that belongs to you to cross, alongside the Magician, Justice, the Emperor or the Star to explore your own universe, to mobilize your own forces and your own resources, whose existence you have sometimes forgotten. You are the only person capable of repelling your Darkness. Have faith in yourself, and soon the Sun will illuminate again the Mornes Plaines of Arcanya.  
To show you the prices in dollars, the amounts in euros have been converted at the time of the campaign launch. Slight variations may occur until final settlement. In case of doubt, only the amounts in euros are authentic.
Here is an extract from the sublime symphonic orchestration composed by Lisa Van Hal, and a small note from her and the soloist singer Julie Elven, who will sing on the main theme of Arcanya.

[FR] Bonjour à tous !
Quelques news, enfin ! Les choses avancent, mais cela me semble tellement lent ! Je n'ai toujours pas d'images des boîtes finies car l'imprimerie s'est excusée d'avoir une très grosse charge de travail mais la responsable de notre projet m'a assuré que nous les aurons très bientôt ! Nous l'avons donc immédiatement envoyée à , afin qu'elle puisse passer en studio et enregistrer les pistes vocales, mais son emploi du temps est également très chargé puisqu'elle enregistre depuis plusieurs semaines la bande originale d'un grand jeu vidéo en même temps que d'autres projets annexes. Julie m'a toutefois personnellement assuré qu'elle pourrait interpréter et enregistrer le thème d'Arcanya . campaign.story:
Thank you so much for being here with me, and for supporting my project in every way possible.
Unfortunately we didn’t reach the funding goal. However! (the fancy but) This deck is a symbol of dreams coming true, and that means the deck will also come true. I found a different printing company where there isn’t a minimum order required. Let's call it Plan B!
I just ordered a first sample to see how the deck will look and I’m very excited about it, and I hope that you are too! There will be a few changes overall because the printing companies don’t have the same options. If you are still interested in the deck, I will post more information about it on my Instagram, feel free to visit me any time: @soulpathic
In the meantime I thank you all so much, for all your support and all lovely and motivating messages.
It was a lovely experience to create this campaign and to meet all of you. I am so happy that I got this far and I’m not planning on stopping here.  
‘I’m so excited, I’m jumping to heaven!’
The Peaceful Mind Tarot Deck consists of 78 Tarot Cards (22 Major Arcana and 56 Minor Arcana). The deck is based on traditional Rider Waite Tarot system.
The Deck will be presented in a lovely book shape box. The cards will be printed on 400gsm, matte laminated card stock with matte pastel pink edges. The size of the tarot cards is 3.5 x 5.75 inches (88.9mm x 146mm) - bigger than usual tarot size.
RENDERING - Final deck may have slight differences.
Two of the cards have changed names: The Magician has become The Mage, and The Hierophant has become Spirit Guide.
Each Major Arcana card includes astrology and zodiac correspondence - Planet symbols on the right, zodiac symbols on the left and each minor arcana includes 4 elements symbol on the top of each card.
The printing company I'm collaborating with has years of experience and has produced hundreds of thousands of decks (tarot, oracle, poker, etc). Including decks from previous Kickstarter campaigns. The very professional contact I have with the company and lovely customer service, enabled for me to view a few videos so I could ensure the quality of the product, specifically the quality of the cards and box manufacture. I am very pleased, and I trust that the final outcome will be more than satisfying. Please note, the printed samples, card images and booklet on the video is not 100% final, there have been changes and improvements.
These are not final cards, I hand cut out the sample I recieved. Final cards will be more vivid than the sample print.
The Peaceful Mind Tarot deck will also come with a 60 page beginner's guide booklet (b&w inside pages, full colour cover). Pretty simple and basic meanings for each card as my wish is for you to connect with the deck and give the cards new meanings, based on your intuition and feelings. The booklet also includes an explanation for astrological and zodiac correspondence.
Digital preview of three pages from the booklet (updated version)
TO SUM UP:
Deck size:  88.9mmx146mm (3.5 x 5.75 inches)
400gsm, matte finish, pastel pink edges. 
Lovely book shape box, matte finish.
A 60 page booklet 88.9mmx146mm (3.5 x 5.75 inches)
Rendering

 30 Days

SHIPPING DECKS TO BACKERS
As soon as decks will be received - all the shipping will be dealt with by me and my partner. I take full responsibility for the shipping.
 Gift card can be sent in a digital format | Latest delivery date for rewards in hands between March-April 2021 - There is a very big chance, that all rewards might be shipped earlier however, I wanted to give extra time just in case any unexpected delays.
Each reward has it's own title: 'Highlight', 'Key Ring', 'Tarot Birdies', 'Tarot Lover', 'Tarot Reader', 'Tarot Admirer', 'Tarot Collector', 'Tarot Giver', 'Tarot Surpriser' and 'Tarot's Ark'.
Please look at the Reward Tiers (image below) to fully understand what is included in each reward. Each product will also be described in details below.
PLEASE NOTE: If you would like to gift the deck to your loved ones, I will be happy to send a digital gift card over to you (pdf or jpg format - whatever your preference) once campaign ends. 

You now have the possibility to add something extra to your reward. :)
For example:
If you are an Early Birdie and would like to add the Tarot/Altar Cloth to your reward, go to 'Manage your pledge' and on the top, there will be little arrow to go to 'ADD-ONS' section.

(Icons: Card Readings, Spreads, Crystal Ball, Book of Shadows, Crystal Magic and Rituals)
Key Ring - made from 100% recycled premium acrylic (both sides printed). You can choose between 2 designs - The Fool's hat and The Hermit's lamp.  (You will be able to choose the shape in the survey, after campaign ends)
Tarot/ Altar cloth - 100% Cotton Twill - You can choose between 2 designs:
Pink - digital single side print + white overlock hem. 50x50cm/ 19x19 inches

Digital Copies of the stickers


RENDERING
The creation of The Peaceful Mind Tarot deck started when my whole journey with tarot reading began. Not being in a great place myself I started to explore with spirituality, meditation and tarot. Like a lot of us I watched Youtube channels all with fantastic readers, I watched and admired them... I was simply fascinated how those beautiful images can awaken our intuition, our imagination to be able to see and tell stories and situations that have happened and that could possibly happen soon. I need this in my life! This is what I was missing! With getting to know each card, its symbolism's and primary meanings I decided to create my own deck, it helped me a lot with visualising and memorizing. Creating this deck brought so much happiness and peace into my life. As artists we have our ups and downs and sometimes we don't know what to do with ourselves however, every time I could see the progress of the deck it helped me come back on track. There were many changes involved, and once I was happy with the final card design, a week later I said it's not good enough! (who else is guilty?!) It's a project that consumed my time in the best way. It's a big part of my heart and if it will ever reach to being an actual deck, I hope it will bring you so much lovely energy, happiness and peace as much as it brought to me whilst I was creating it.
My name is Aleksandra, I live in the UK and I am a print designer and visual artist. I'm the Fool on my spiritual journey which I would like to share with you. Creating The Peaceful Mind Tarot deck was the beginning of the process of stepping out of my comfort zone, of helping me realise that everyone deserves to go for their dreams instead of letting the fear step ahead, and create an invisible barrier that seems impossible to overtake. We've all been there and we all need a little push sometimes to step forward. Let's this lovely deck be that light thrust, a symbol of mind balance that will remind us to not be afraid of dreaming and reaching high. 
Thank you so much for being here and thank you for your support!

campaign.story:
We are fully funded!
But we're not out of the woods yet! Help us reach our stretch goals so we can make more rodeos and pay our cowpokes!
Isn't about a time we celebrated queer artists in country music?
I'm Rachel Cholst, a music journalist from New York City who has been writing about the queer country music community for the last 9 years. My articles have appeared in No Depression, Wide Open Country, The Boot, Country Queer, and my own blog and podcast Adobe & Teardrops. I have also launched two successful Kickstarter campaigns for my comic, Artema.
It's been a dream of mine to create a zine to celebrate queer country music: one where writers can get paid and we can share our stories far and wide. As far as I know, this will be the first physical magazine ever solely devoted to queer country music.
Why should the zine be limited to bookstores? If artists sell the zine at their merch tables, we can spread the word about each other and build community. Not only do we create emotional bonds, but we can support each other financially as well. 
Each article in our very first issue tells the story of artists growing into their communities. Become a part of community by contributing today. 
The zine will be 4.25" x 11", 28 pages with a full-color glossy cover (see above.) Our initial goal will cover a print run of 100 copies.
Our Stories
In issue 1 of Rainbow Rodeo, you'll find...
Personal essays by queer country artists Sarah Shook and catherine the great 
Features by Jason Scott (B-Sides & Badlands, American Songwriter) and artist Paisley Fields about how queer country musicians are marketed,a feature by Mya Byrne (artist, writer for Country Queer) about Elton John's Tumbleweed Connection, and one by Rachel Cholst about the Country Music Against White Supremacy initiative
A behind-the-scenes look at Jeremy LeRoux's short film about a closeted gay country singer, Dominant Chord 
Interviews with artists Jake Blount and Amythyst Kiah 
Music reviews by Rachel Cholst, Annelise Domineghini (Vice, Noisey, Nylon), Eryn Brothers (Country Queer), and Sunny West
Full-color cover by comic book artist and illustrator Luyi Bennett 
Fabulous layouts by musician Bug Martin (he's multi-talented!)
Unlocked Story #1: Karen Pittleman (of Karen and the Sorrows) on the politics of queer country music and who gets to tell our story
Unlocked Story #2: Bluegrass musician Justin Hiltner shares his experiences with cancer, music, and recovery.
Our Budget
In the interest of transparency, you can see how writers and artists are getting paid and where the costs are going on this spreadsheet. These rates are comparable to online publications, and all contributors will be given 5 copies of the zine to sell.
The Rewards
You can contribute to our project at any financial level! (And if you can't, please share this project widely!)
Here's a look at the unicorn pin at the $15 tier:
NEW: Fly the flag and get a Queer Country shirt! Only 3 available for $30!!!
Stretch Goals
$1200 -- We can print 200 copies. 
$2150 -- We can print 200 copies and double the writers' pay!
$4050 -- We can print 200 copies, pay the writers, and fully fund issue 2!
If our final funding amount is somewhere between our stretch goals, contributors will vote to save it for issue 2 or distribute among themselves.

campaign.story:
Hi! My name is Mariza, artist behind Mari in the Sky. 
I am a nature-inspired illustrator, creating a hand-drawn tarot deck filled with imagery influenced by life in remote Alaska. It is touched throughout by my indigenous spiritual background. 
I draw much of my strength and inspiration from our natural environment, as it has always been my comfort and guide. I strongly believe that our mental health is very much influenced by our connection or lack of connection with our ecosystem. The art of these cards attempts to bridge the gap and remind us of the power and love found there.
For each pledge, I will personally contribute to the planting of two trees and 10% of total proceeds of present and future sales will be donated to ocean and climate change research. 
I very much appreciate your social media shares and your help with spreading the word about this labor of love! 
Follow me on Instagram for more art! https://www.instagram.com/mariinthesky
Pledge rewards 
All backers receive a freebie frame-worthy art print postcard as a Thank You! 

Inspiration 
Having grown up with ceremony and daily rituals that connect us with the elements, songs that ancestors sang with words and sounds that speak to this connection, I am inspired to share the love, honor, and respect that our planet is due.  It is my hope that the love embedded in my work can serve as a reminder of this connection so that we may feel supported by our natural environment and also responsible for its well-being. Heal your self, heal the earth.
Flower of Thunder inspired by the 6-year old drawing of mine displayed below. <3
I have lived in Alaska since 2014, working on remote rivers across southwest Alaska. I collect data on wild Alaskan salmon during the summer season. One of my favorite things about this field work is that it requires living completely off-grid for periods of two to four months. This time is spent working seven days a week, monitoring rivers, enumerating and speciating salmon as they make their way to their spawning grounds. I co-exist with the bears, foxes, eagles, and all other wildlife. These remote locations are far from cell phone and internet connection. This environment provides much time for introspection, healthy soul work, and creativity. 
Young bear at Orzinski river on the Alaskan peninsula.
Illustrating a tarot deck had long been on my mind. I had no idea that the wave of energy behind this deck was so strong. I have witnessed my craft evolve and I have also become more in tune with the process of allowing pieces to create themselves. 
Sample print in home studio. First time seeing a handful of them together! The First Edition will not have white rims.
Working on a tarot deck is synonymous with working on oneself. Taking up a project like this involves tearing down the walls of fear and doubt, especially, when you have never published a book, searched for manufacturers, started a crowd-funding campaign, or exposed intimate parts of yourself with a wide audience. Meditating with individual cards for days at a time and processing the meanings internally, has helped me have faith that the wave of energy inside me has a destination. Likewise, continual research and learning, reaching out to other artists with similar projects, and dedicating all of my free time to this labor of love has smoothed out the process. 
It is my ultimate wish that this Gentle Tarot deck support and encourage others to follow their wildest dreams as it has supported and encouraged me. 
Sqaure versions of the card illustrations are available as matted prints on museum quality, acid-free base, 100% cotton rag archival paper.
If you are new to Tarot, here’s a quick how-to!
There are many ways to engage with tarot cards. It can be done alone or in the company of others. Generally, an intention is set or a question is asked. This can be done silently to yourself or out loud. Feel free to shuffle the deck. The cards can be spread out on a table. Choose a card at random. Use the guidebook to read about the card you chose. You can read this yourself or have your partner read it.
Pulling three cards per person is common. They can represent past, present, and future or simply add additional clarity about a single topic/question you have in mind. You will find more information about different ‘tarot spreads’ in the Gentle Tarot guidebook.
Using tarot cards is a fun and healthy way to engage with inner emotions and also a great way to engage in meaningful conversation.
May the Gentle Tarot lift your spirit and fill you with the love and support that you need. 
Wild foxes roam free on Unalaska Island. They often approach you playfully as if you were also a fox. Even the ones far from town without human exposure do this. Bridging the gap for sure. Love 'em!
The Deck:
The deck is a classic 78 card deck. Some of the cards are lightly based on the Rider-Waite deck, however many of the illustrations are the result of complete surrender to creative/spiritual process. Motifs and symbols, along with colors, have been used throughout the deck to make for easy recognition and to assist with remembering the meanings of the cards.
The minor arcana labels have been slightly modified, Swords have become Thunder and Pentacles have become Stones.
The cards have color coded rims to match their element:.
Major Arcana - Spirit - Purple
Cups - Water - Blue
Wands - Fire - Red
Thunder - Air - Yellow
Stones - Earth - Green

The Gentle Tarot also exhibits mostly people of color. As an indigenous woman, it feels important to create work with representation because it too often is lacking in the mainstream. We should love our bodies as they are and be proud of our history and proud of whatever skin color we have.
Brown skin representation. <3
Unalaska tundra flowers
Donation of 10% of proceeds:
A lot of the creatures I use in the deck are reflective of animals we have here in Alaska, some of them being endangered species. The world is changing very quickly and I hope that we can all do our part to cause less harm.
10% of proceeds will be donated to ocean and climate change research. I am presently researching the best avenues for this and very much look forward to being able to contribute to the health of our planet.
Photo taken on return flight from remote work in Kodiak. We have a beautiful planet, let's take care of it!
Timeline:
Manufacturing of the Gentle Tarot deck and book is scheduled to begin mid-October, with final designs being submitted by the early October.
An overly conservative 4 weeks are allocated for print time and an additional 4 weeks are added for shipping. 
Deck/book sets are scheduled to arrive mid-December and ready to ship shortly after.
Some hand-made reward items, such as the custom fold-over deck pouch and hand-printed items, may be delayed and available January. (But I will do all that I can to make them ready when the decks arrive!)
 March 2021 is a safety measure. Unfortunately I can't make promises, but I will do my very best to get these to you by the holidays.
If the hand-printed linocut items (tote bags and session cloths) are delayed for an unforeseeable reason, these items may be printed by a third party for timely delivery. 
Sqaure designs available for the signed limited edition prints. The artist will work with you directly to make a square print of your desired illustration.
Cost (Updated 10/17/20):
$23,100 cost of shipping (to myself from manufacturer) and production of deck/book set. There are a total of 79 cards (started out as 78 but we added a Bonus card!!) made with 350 gsm matte laminate paper with matte gold edges - card size 2.75" x 4.75" (70mm x 120mm). The book has increased in size since the inception of this kickstarter and is now at 4.75" by 5.75" (118mm x 144mm) with 250gsm matte laminate full color cover and recycled ivory paper inside, 196 pages total. Both will be packaged together in a two part box. 
Kickstarter fees are about 10%
Estimate increase from $2,400 to $14,750 for shipping of rewards. Shipping the deck set costs $8-$26 each, not including shipping of extra items. The new estimate is an average for 800 rewards. 
International shipping starts at $24. I am covering partial cost of international shipping as an attempt to not dissuade lovers of the Gentle Tarot from other parts of the world. 
Estimate cost of non-deck rewards has increased from $1,500 to $10,500 for: session cloths, tote bags, earrings, custom deck pouches, Gentle Tarot fabric for upgraded pouches, and art prints.
Self publishing fees: ISBN, copyright, and barcode $380
Estimate total has increased, however the ongoing support has increased. I have been fortunate to upgrade a lot of our items and will be outsourcing the deck pouches to be sewn locally and the session clothes will be made with organic cotton (Yay to zero pesticide use!). I am also excited to offer a bigger guidebook! I thought I would have to wait until the Second Edition to be able to afford it.
What a response The Gentle Tarot has had!!! THANK YOU for the love and support! I will be creating a website so that you can stay connected with The Gentle Tarot once this campaign is over. (www.thegentletarot.com) Add-on's plus other items not available here will be offered on the website!

Unalaska Island, Alaska and life in the Bering Sea. This is a photo on the return from remote field camp only accessible by boat.
Please feel free to reach out if you have any questions or would like to make specific reward requests!
I whole-heartedly appreciate your support in making this deck a reality.
Thank you for participating in the birth of the Gentle Tarot.
You can follow my work here: https://www.instagram.com/mariinthesky
Printing and cutting first samples in home studio
For as long as I can remember, I have drawn my surroundings. Here is my highly nature-influenced art at 6 years old. :) Night time on one side of the teepee and sunshine with multiple rainbows on the other. The eagle on the front has lightning bolts coming from his feet. New moon and star on drawing behind this one. My mom and I traveled to ceremony in Montana, North Dakota, and Alberta Canada during much of my childhood. Living in teepees must have prepared me well for off-grid work in Alaska.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main challenge of this campaign is exposure. I work a full-time job, plus a part-time job and create all of my art after hours or on weekends. I am not an expert with social media or putting my work out there in the world, and I know there is risk when you don't start off with a hefty audience. 

I am learning how to find media outlets (online blogs, forums, and local public radio) to spread the word about my Gentle Tarot project. I hope that with my efforts, along with those of newcomers discovering my work, that together we can round up enough support to bring this deck to life.

An additional risk, which appears to be common, is if the items are not delivered on-time. Based on my schedule, they should be ready to deliver by mid-December. This is my first time embarking on a printing/publishing endeavor and I am trusting the timeline given to me by my manufacturer, plus adding additional buffer. Although I cannot make any guarantees, I will do my best to have these delivered by the holidays.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Loves!
I've been meaning to write to you for some time now. (There are still a handful of you that need to submit surveys. Please do, your decks are waiting for you!) I hope you are all doing well and enjoying the coming of Summer.
I am excited to announce that The Gentle Tarot Pocket Deck along with the full-size, full-color Guidebook will be launching (together) on Kickstarter before the end of the month!
I spent the majority of May and June finalizing the new edits of all of our cards to fit the new pocket size, as well as color correction and the addition of a NEW card!!

Hellooo!! 
Oh I can hear the echo it has been so long. :) 
Just sending a quick update:
The art print rewards are in the process of being matted and prepped for shipping. My partner has been a big help in this department as I have returned to my full time job. I am hoping to have them all shipped by Wednesday.

Hello loves!
If you have not received your shipping notice yet, no worries! There were some delays and we are doing our very best to hopefully finish ALL fulfillment by tonight! 
38 of you have not submitted your survey!! Login to Kickstarter with a desktop computer and see alert banner for survey! Last handful of hours to submit or you may be waiting a long time!

updates.update_content:
Ohmygoodness!! We are tackling almost 1,400 packages! (360 of those are Etsy/website orders. They are being sent after yours -no worries!) 😉 At first it felt impossible and I was pretty stressed, and I was advised that I needed more like at least a month, but we are doing it in two weeks and it's coming together!!
