campaign.story:
Lindorm Dice is a small company based in south of Sweden. Where we live, sagas and myths have been a strong influence our entire life, and it's not strange that we fell in love with role playing! As the years passed by, we noticed how much dice could enhance how we view our characters and adventures. Dice put a face on spells, on interactions, on characters. They tell a story. And so, with our passion for sagas and our passion for dice, we are on a journey to create mythological dice!
Last year, we held our first dice kickstarter and it went above and beyond our expectations! Now that our old kickstarter has shipped, we are ready to take on a new adventure!
For anyone backing for at least 1 item within the first 48 hours will recieve a free black raven coin in raised metal! 
 Surtr, the Jötunn often called the lord of fire, and guardian of Muspelheim. Surtr weild a burning sword, bright as the sun itself. Myth has it, that his home Muspelheim, was so hot, that the embers flew far away and created the stars in the sky.

 A slumbering giant, deep inside the norse woods, maybe mistaken for a huge, mossy rock. We present, Troll! The norse trolls are depicted as a huge brown and mossy creature. They live deep inside the dark forests, because when the sun hits their skin, they turn to stone. They loved riches and collected them down in the mountain halls.

Skade is the god of the snow and mountains, and so also gave name to the entire Scandinavia! There, she hunts with bow and arrow with wolves as her companions. Though once married to Njord, the god of the ocean, she couldn't stand the sound of the sea birds, and missed her mountains dearly The relationsship only lasted 9 days, but after all they met through a blind date where Skade got to choose her partner only from viewing their feet!

Frej, the fertility god and protector of harvests. He is the brother of Freja but have just as much in common with his father Njord. He can traverse both sea and land with his ship, and with his boar Gyllenborste he can travel the air faster than any horse could run on land.

Mimir, son of Ymir, and possibly Odin's Uncle, was the guardian of Mimir's well, the fountain of wisdom. The same well Odin gave his eye for, only to drink from it's waters. In the end of the early war between Aesir and Vanir, a misunderstanding happened and the Vanir gods cut Mimir's head of. Odin kept the head from rotting by embalming it with herbs and singing galdrar in it's honor. This kept Mimir's spirit alive and the head would often give Odin sound advice.
 The Lindorm is a giant ash-white snake, often portrayed with human/drake like arms and a great flowing mane. It's long enough to bite it's own tail and you can often find a big Lindorm on norse runestones. If you were lucky enough a touch of it's skin could transfer magical abilities to you. There are many tales about the Lindorm, some say they are good, some evil. One such tale is the tale about Kind Lindorm that was a prince, turned in to a lindorm, but a amiden turned him back to his former self.
 Yggdrasil, the everlasting world tree. It's ashen branshes reaches far above the sky, and the rain that falls to our earth is dew from it's leaves. Yggdrasils roots leads to the many different realms and has to be carefully watered each day. The name Yggdrasil translates closely to: Odins horse, Ygg is another name for Odin meaning stormgod, and drasil means horse. This could either be because Valhall (Odins home) lies on top of the tree, or because he once sacrificed him self to hang by the throught in the tree for 9 days only to learn about the magical runes.
 Sleipnir is Odins loyal horse, and of course the son of Loki. Faster than the wind, he can travel both the earth, the sky and the sea. It is told that Sleipnir carries fallen heroes on his back, home to Valhall- Odins keep.

Fenrir, one of Loki's sons, the ultimate big bad wolf. He is said to have been raised in the iron woods as the proud wolf (the darkest and deepest of all the woods), and is the beast to finally swallow Odin at Ragnarök. He is also father to the two wolfs Skoll and Hati (born by a witch in the iron woods). His son Skoll will be the won to swallow the sun at Ragnarök.

Heimdall, The guardian of bifrost, with amazing sight and hearing, he is keeping watch day and night. Still an aesir, he is said to have been sent down to the humans in a basket together with tools and knowledge. There, he taught the first humans about fire and handiwork.
Fun facts: he has gold teeth and as many as nine mothers! Some also say he is the son to Rans nine daugthers, the waves.

Saga, the godess of stories and tales. She lives in Sökkvabäck, where a cold, freshwater brook streams around her. There, she and Odin sits a time each day to happily drink from golden cups and share stories. She is, by all means, Odins drinking bud! She is associated with water and her knowledge like the flowing springs!
Draugr, They live in their own, or sometimes a rich persons grave where they guard the treassure burried with the dead. Their name is more or less Ghost in old norse and they should have been followed by a stench of death and rot. They hold inhumane strength and can change their density up on will. Odin, as guardian of the dead together with Freja, was sometimes called Draugadrotten, the lord of draugr.
Dice samples are already made! No renders!
The dice you are seeing are all finished samples and the produced dice are expected to look similiar to those pictured! Pattern and swirls are unique for every die of course, but other than that, they will stay the same. 
Early bird reward: If you pledge single saga or higher within the first 48 hours (before Sep 17, 5 PM Swedish time) you will recieve this beautiful exclusive raised metal Coin in black nickel finish. The coin depicts Hugin and Munin on the front, and on the back you will find the mask of Odin! The coin will be 35 mm wide.

How do I add an Add-on?
Add-ons can be added to any pledge. When you have chosen your pledge just add the cost of the item you want to the pledge amount. For example: You want to pledge at the Triology saga level (with a cost of 39$) then you want to add the Barrel dice box for $18. To do this when choosing the pledge you simply change the pledge amount to $57 (39 + 18).
As soon as possible after the campaign is finished every backer will receive a backer kit survey in which you can confirm wich items you want to add.
 Extra dice set: If you would like to add an extra dice set to your order, just add 134 sek to your pledge!
Blue PU-leather dice bag: This little viking inspired dice pouch holds 3 standard sets or two 11-pcs sets! It closes both with the strong and with the matellic button on the middle compartment. If you would like to add this dice bag to your pledge, just ad 77 Sek.
 Kickstarter Exclusive Barrel dice box: We are so proud to present this exclusive wooden barrel dice box we had the pleasure to design! It holds about 18 dice and works very well as a dice cup.  It's 11,5 cm high and 6cm wide and features a rune on the front + our logo on the press down lid. Lid sits very firmly! The wood is finished in a medium brown with a hint of red! If you would like to add this dice box to you pledge, just add 158 Sek.

 Dice vault: This beautiful dice vault comes in ash wood with a 3D engraved logo on the lid. When you open it there  6 different compartments, and together they house sets. The inside of the lid is covered in a felt fabric with a golden logo that turns to a dice tray when laid on the table. The box has firm magnets and you can easily shake the vault upside down without the lid moving at all. To add this dice vault to your pledge, just add 307 Sek.

 Viking saga coin: A raised metal coin in antique silver finish that features our logo +  a quote from Grettis Saga from the 15th hundreds, The qoute says: "A tale is but half told if only one person tells it". On the back you will find the old rune Aegishjalmur that is a translated to: the helm of awe/fear. Vikings bore the symbol to war (preferably on their forhead) to gain protection, strike fear in their oponents, and to gain victory in battle. The coin is 35 mm long. To add 1 coin to your pledge, add 53 Sek, and to add 5 coins, add 140 sek.

 Raven coin: A raised metal coin in antique gold finish that features a Hugin and Munin on the front, and on the back you will find a quote reading: Hugin and Munin fly each day over the spacious earth, which is a quote from the Edda. In the middle you will also find the symbol for the mask of Odin. It's a complicated knot that shows the gods head with the striking beard. Have been found in different versions, here in a Mammen style. The coin is 35 mm long. To add 1 coin to your pledge, add 53 Sek, and to add 5 coins, add 140 sek.

 Runestone dice: We are so happy to be working with Crit Hit ceramics to bring you these amazing runestone dice. They are finished in a light grey ceramic with the classic blood red inking that is usally used when filling runestones. On the 6 side of the D6, there is a rune depicted, called Vegvísir. The magical stave is a sort of compass that will help you find your way, even when you don't know where you are going. It's speculated if it is based on the Aegishjalmur, and also if the eight staves represent the different realms, with the middle being yggdrasil. A simplistic map if you will! To add this to your pledge, just add 526 Sek.
Raven dice scroll: This is a scroll that will give home to 2 sets of dice and double as a roll out dice mat. It comes printed with black runes saying Lindorm Dice (spelled Lindorm Dais as runes spells sound, also the futhark we use doesn't really have the letter C). when opened you can see an engraving of Hugin and Munin - matching the raven coin. To add this to your pledge, just add 149 Sek.
Hooded Viking cardigan: This amazing cardigan features a thigh long flowing design, with a large, dramatic hood. This cardigan is made with Urban classics designer clothes and has a high thickness and soft fabric that makes it perfect for the whole year around. On the back you will find printed in gold, the old rune Aegishjalmur, witch name means: the helm of awe/fear. Vikings bore the symbol to war (preferably on their forhead) to gain protection, strike fear in their oponents, and to gain victory in battle. Comes in S - 5XL (size chart will be available in the backer kit survey). To add this to your pledge, just add 806 Sek.


Shipping: It's time to ship your dice! When the kickstarter ends, dice will be made within 3 -4 months, and then sent off to our supporters, CerberusSupplies and Little Dragon Corp, who will take care of all the shipping. Dice will be shipped from China and Canada, this way we save time, money and the environment.
We have chosen to go as environmentally friendly as possible. Therefore we won't package in the otherwise common and a bit cheaper alternative - plastic. Instead, we are having all your sets packed in hessian bags and shipped in eco friendly mailers.
Here on kickstarter we will be giving continuous updates about the production and shipping process after the kickstarer campaign ends until all pledges are shipped!
Shipping costs will be paid after the kickstarter ends via BackerKit when all dice sets and add ons can be counted.
The cost will be counted as per item. Unlocked freebies won't affect this amount! Example: You have bought 2 dice sets, and paid for 1 extra add on. 3 Freebies was unlocked. Then you will only pay the 1-4 Items shipping cost, not 6.

THANK YOU!
This year has been absolutely crazy. A roller coaster like no other where we have been amazingly excited but also nervous for what the future holds! During this entire time you have been by our side, cheering us on and giving advice. We are so very thankful for those of you who have stuck with us and for those who have recently started to follow us and our project. It's thank to you that we can strive and continue to make our dream a reality. Our company will never be bigger than the people supporting it, and to have grown this much this past year... campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and challenges
All our dice tests are already made and the dice are ready to be produced. We are using the same dice factories as in our last kickstarter since we were very happy with how they turned out, and with the friendliness of the workers!

The biggest risk with our Kickstarter, as noticed last time, is not to have the dice finished in time. They were finished long and well before shipping. But rather that we are an international kickstarter and we want to ship to anyone across the world. This makes it somewhat hard to know exactly when shipping is. Last time we added many months to our expected shipping goal, but then Covid 19 came. We can't know for certain if a second wave is coming, but we have chosen to imagine that it will not, and instead added another extra month on top of our shipping estimate.

This year we are also changing how the shipping works a little. We noticed that shipping from only one country was a little tricky. So this time we have chosen to have a separate shipping agent for the US (75% of our backers last year). We will be working with Coelette Miller from Little dragon corp, who has had amazing customer service and shipping times on her own kickstarters. She is an awesome human being, also running her own local game shop. Dice, add ons, freebies, you name it, will be sent to her. She will organize, pack and ship all the US orders. This means we can avoid delays between countries.

For the remaining countries, we will use Cerberus supplies, just like last time. They are a great company focusing on helping other creators to send their kickstarters, pack their orders, and even talk with factories and workers locally in China. We have spent many hours in skype chatting back and forth about add on designs and packaging. They have many successfull kickstarter shippings behind them and are truly passionate about what they do. We have all these skills in one place and in that way we can eliminate the risk of loosing information in transition. 

They are wonderful people and have been amazingly patient with us this past year of Corona delays, and have worked so hard to help us deliver as fast as possible!

Also, this year we have made the choice to make our dice boxes with different people. We had some problems with our boxes last kickstarter, although they turned our pretty they took way longer to create than was agreed. This time we will use a more well known factory with a higher quality wood!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
It's been a long and treacherous battle since the very beginning. Tough crowds, high mountains and unforeseen battles that just don't seem to end. As you rest your head down, you start to wonder what futures lie ahead. After all, what's a journey without a little bit of peril and danger?
But this is it, ladies and gentlemen! The moment you've been waiting for! The pièce de résistance! Where that one drop reaches the river.... We bring you Court's Align! A collaborative fantasy tarot project created with over 40 artists and 5 writers!

Tarot cards
This project is a collaborative project under the wonderous theme of fantasy with over 40 artists and 5 writers coming together to create:
Various merchandise such as buttons, stickers, charms and an enamel pin!
 A guide book with the tarot readings and information about the card artwork
78 tarot cards both including the major and minor arcana
But what are tarot cards?
The origins of tarot cards were in the mid 15th century in Europe and are a type of deck of playing cards similar to your typical modern playing deck with a major arcana along with the 4 suits typically called the minor arcana (Wands, Cups, Swords and Pentacles) including 14 cards from Ace to King respectively. 
A twist that started in the 1700s in Paris has given these cards new divinatory meanings to predict the past, present and the future. It gives insight and awareness to even events that we otherwise would miss in our subconsciousness. Your fortune depends on which arcana or suit you pick along with the orientation (either right up or in reverse!)


Card art

Major Arcana 
Minor Arcana
Suit of Wands
Suit of Cups
Suit of Swords
Suit of Pentacles

Tiers
As mentioned, the Project is a fantasy themed Tarot deck cards. There are 4 different bundle orders; Crow, Knight, Mage, and Dragon Bundles.  

Crow - The Crow Bundle consist of the Tarot Deck PDF and Guide book PDF for $12.
Knight - The Knight Bundle consist of the physical 78 count card tarot deck for only $30.
Mage - The Mage Bundle consists of the physical 78 count card tarot deck and the physical 80+ page count  A5 guide book for $40.
Dragon - The Dragon Bundle includes the physical 78 count card tarot deck, 80+ page count A5 guide book, 4 buttons, 2 holographic charms, 1 stickersheet, and 1 enamel pin.

Stretch goals:
We also have stretch goals appearing at the 60, 130 and 190 mark respectively! Please note that these will only be added to the physical bundles. Want to know what's hidden under those masks? There is but one way to find out!
UPDATE!: We have reached the first stretch goal! Please consider helping us reach the finish!


Extras!
Note that when creating your pledge, you can:
 Add $4 more to Knight, Mage, and Dragon bundles for a PDF version of the Tarot Card Deck and the Zine book will be included in your purchase.
 And/ or add $6 more to any bundle and one of our artists will create a digital doodle just for you! Remember to let us know what doodle/ character you would like when you pledge in the notes/ message/ comments!

Our Contributors
Follow us on our social media handles!
 Twitter  |  Tumblr  |  Instagram 

Alas, we will have to part ways here, dear fellow traveller. However, have no fear! It is but a momentary moment of separation. This place we call our home is large and vast. We vision that our paths will intertwine yet again in the near future. Till then, keep exploring and find what fantasies may be lurking behind...
Please note that due to the increase of cost of USPS and the possible weight of the package, the shipping flat rate cost will be $15. Tracking is included .

campaign.story:
Starbound: A Space Sci-Fi Comics Anthology
What is starbound
Starbound is an all ages graphic anthology featuring stories about Space and Exploration. These stories have been crafted by writers and artists from a wide range of backgrounds, experience, and styles, which reflects the great diversity and vast experiences that science fiction can provide.
Stranded by PD Loupee & Yen Quach (left) - The Botanist by Lindsey Leigh (right)
This 120 page anthology is being organized by The Boston Comics Roundtable, the longest running comics creative group in New England, who has also organized several recent successful anthology kickstarters for the Boston Powers and the Award Nominated anthology Being True.
Comfort in the Dark by Maya Ferguson (left) - Lost and Found by Pattra Audcharevorakul (right)
Starbound collects works by new writers from all backgrounds.   Many of our contributors have never before been published, and Starbound is driven by their stories that embrace new and exciting takes on a beloved genre. By supporting this anthology you will be helping our crew reach out to the stars.
Rebuild by Skye Thompson (left) - Elixer by Kit Whitecar
And even more, featuring comics from Brendan Tobin, Jason Doring, Fell Hound, Brandon Sichling, Lindsey Leigh, PD Loupee, Yen Quach, Skye Thompson, David Aus, Pattra Audcharevorakul, Kit Whitecar, Cassidy Sulaiman, Alex Harris, Mike Saver, David Cardino, Liz Young, Maura McGonagle, Renie Jesanis, Sam Bennet, James McGarry, Maya Ferguson, Lulu Tang, and Adrian Alvarez.
The Goals
Starbound’s main goal is $5,000.  This goal will allow us to pay each collaborating team of writers and artists a page rate of $25 per page.  Each stretch goal beyond the original goal will be entirely focused on raising that page rate further and on supporting additional printing costs.

Stretch Goal Number 1 of $7,500 includes:
All collaborator teams will get $30 per page instead of $25
All tiers $30 and up will also get a Book Plate (design TBD, and will be posted here when we have a design!)
Rewards
 Rewards for this kickstarter campaign include:
Copies of the finished book, both digital (PDF) and physical.
A print designed by Kristen Lee (https://twitter.com/Feather_Notes)
Print designed by Kristen Lee
A Bookmark designed by Maura McGonagle (https://twitter.com/doingartiguess) and Kyri Lorenz (https://twitter.com/TheKyrianne).
Bookmark
A sticker designed by Liz Young (https://twitter.com/indigo_liz).
Sticker by Liz Young
Risks
The main risk for this project is that if we do not meet our goal, given the current climate caused by Covid-19, we will be unable to publish printed copies and will not be able to pay our contributors. Additionally, there may be printing delays related to the ongoing pandemic.
Thank you for supporting this Kickstarter! Whether you back or not, please be sure to share on social media with #starbound and help us tell our stories!
https://twitter.com/BostonComics

updates.update_content:
Hello all!!! We have shipped about half of the backer rewards so far, and we are shipping the other half next week!! Thank you all for your support in this project, we are so excited to finally get this book in your hands!!
If you have any issues with your orders as they arrive at your doorsteps over the next month or so, please let us know!

Good evening everyone!!
We are happy to announce that Starbound has officially been sent off to our printing company! We are awaiting the proof to arrive for us to proceed with getting the presses fired up, but we are very excited! 
This means that we will be sending out links to the PDF for everyone in the coming weeks, once a final check of the book has been performed by the printer. We are VERY excited to get these rewards out to folks!

Good morning everyone!!
We are finalizing the book as we speak, however we need folks to complete their reward surveys! If you could all please complete your reward surveys no later than Friday January 22nd, that would ensure your name will get on the thank you pages!
Thank you all for your support! We cant wait to get this book to everyone!

Hello everyone! It's been a bit since I last updated folks, so I figured I'd let folks know what we've been up to!
We are currently in the process of paying the collaborators and designing the book for print, as well as prepping to order all the other rewards.  We still hope to get things in the mail and ready to go for every backer by February or so, barring any production delays.  For those who got the PDF version, we should have that ready for folks within the next couple weeks, so stay tuned!

As we start the dawn of the final day of the kickstarter, we just wanted to reach out to everyone and thank each and every one of you for your support this past month. We wouldnt be where we are without each and every one of you, and we cant wait to get this book in your hands in the coming months <3
Lets get those stretch goals!!

Welcome, please, come inside.
Lonesome Village is a cozy, quiet town struggling to rebuild after a strange calamity wiped out their homes.
Take the role of Wes the coyote and help bring this village back from the brink of destruction in a  puzzle-filled life sim!
Wes, the coyote
 Gorgeous, inviting art style - Lonesome Village is the perfect place to rest up after a long day adventuring.
Discover a detailed and fascinating world full of mystery and adventure.
Solve mind-bending puzzles to gain entry to and make your way up a mysterious magic tower, one dungeon at a time.
Hang out and make friends with a  variety of cute characters.
Save villagers from a perilous stay in the tower and help bring them back home to Lonesome!
 Make Lonesome your home - earn land in the village and build and customize your house inside and out.
 Help Lonesome grow by working in your garden and fishing in the nearby lakes.
Discover the gripping story of Lonesome’s origins and learn about Wes's secret past.
Ever since the Lonesome Village Kickstarter campaign started, our community in Social Media has grown in numbers in a way we didn't expect, and we couldn't be happier about it. Now we would like to ask for your help to keep our great community growing. 
Help us reach the following goals! In exchange, all the backers who get a copy of Lonesome Village with their pledges will receive an additional Kickstarter-exclusive in-game item!

Lonesome Village was conceived as a mix of two concepts we love - the puzzles inside the dungeons of 2D Zelda games and the social & life simulation of Animal Crossing.
Delight in the carefully designed and amazingly cute aesthetic of the Zelda-based overworld and dungeons.
Interact with your neighbors and your environment.
Something interesting to add here is that Lonesome Village has no combat inside the game.
A long time ago, hundreds of years before Lonesome Village even existed, Ubhora was a happy and prosperous town.
Ubhora’s mysterious disappearance is often attributed to The Cult, a group of wizards who wanted to control the world by summoning dark and unknown powers, which ended up destroying them and causing the town's disappearance...
The Cult
Many years later, Lonesome Village was founded on the same ground, and all kinds of people from all over the world came to live there.
Everything was well in Lonesome until a mysterious giant tower arose from the ground once again, and the people of Lonesome soon discovered that the village wanted to remain alone…  
Downtown Lonesome Village
Lonesome Village is Ogre Pixel’s first journey into development for PC and Consoles. At the time, the goal is to finish the game and make it available for Steam and Nintendo Switch. However, the possibility of porting Lonesome Village into more consoles has always been our objective.
 You can wishlist Lonesome Village now on Steam:
Wishlist Lonesome Village on Steam now
Languages 
The mechanics of Lonesome Village will be reminiscent of classic RPGs, but our approach to the day-to-day interactions with different villagers and scenarios as well as life sim elements will make the game feel like a brand-new experience altogether.
Ascend the tower and solve your way to the top!
Find yourself in dungeons that call to mind the atmosphere and quality of the 2D Zelda games.
Solve tricky dungeon puzzles and save villagers in the tower to advance to the next chamber.  
You will find unique puzzles to solve for each animal friend you have to save.   
HELP THE VILLAGE GROW - Unlock new areas and help Lonesome Village thrive through:
Exploring
The Village and its surroundings make up a great area to discover and explore:
Home Customization
Wes is getting used to his new life in Lonesome, so he needs to make himself comfortable in his new house! During the game, you will find, build, and exchange many different items and objects to decorate your new home. 
Fishing 
Gardening 
And more...
Interacting with the villagers you save from the tower will help make your life in Lonesome even more comfortable.
Communicating with your fellow villagers will allow you to be involved in other activities in the town, like:
Item finding and exchange
More exploration
Complete secondary assignments
Trade Items
And more...
Day and night will play an important role in Lonesome Village. Some NPCs can only be found at night, so a significant percentage of the game will take place in the dark.
During the game, you will discover different items and abilities that will help you complete all of your assignments. The "Magic Glass" will help you see into another reality, hidden in some objects and areas of the game. It will be a crucial object to solve some of the puzzles inside the tower. 

As Wes will have much to do in town, he will discover a wide variety of items that will help him during his time in Lonesome. Once your backpack is full, you can leave some of your items at your place in the village.
Interacting with the villagers will also help you at the time of trading items. The more happy or comfortable they're about you, they'll give a better price for sale and will pay you more for your items.
Interacting with the villagers will make your relationship with them even better, which will also make your life in Lonesome easier as they will be nicer with you.

Wes is a curious coyote that has always felt a pull towards strange and mysterious things.
Our little adventurer friend does not live in Lonesome, but he has become involved in the recent odd circumstances surrounding Lonesome and decides to make it his quest to rescue all the villagers that are trapped inside the Tower and save the village from catastrophe.
These are normal people (well, not quite like us, but you know) who want to help the village grow again.
Responsible for Ubhora's disappearance. Will they try to awaken evil again?
We have been working really hard to create a unique aesthetic style. We want to show that every single detail of the game represents our commitment to creating a charming adventure like no other.
The soundtrack of the game will be created by María José Félix. She is a composer and sound designer that has participated in videogame projects like "Greak: Memories of Azur".

Ogre Pixel is an indie studio based in Aguascalientes, Mexico since 2014. Our goal is to create fantasy stories in the form of indie video games.
Our previous game 'Jumper Jon' became the 1st game entirely developed in Mexico for Apple Arcade’s first 100 games release.
The experience we have gained from developing all these years has encouraged us to produce a unique experience for PC and Consoles.
The development of Lonesome Village has been quite slow, up until this point. Since the beginning of the production process, the game has been developed by a small fraction of the Ogre team. These points combined with a lack of funding has made finishing Lonesome Village quite challenging without support. 
The current development advance of Lonesome Village is 1/3 of the total development plan.
However, Lonesome Village has seen a lot of positive reactions from the press and on social media, which have praised the art style and the concept of the game, which motivates us to continue developing this project.
With your support, we can invest more time and resources into finishing the development of our game. We’re committed to bringing the world of Lonesome Village to life, but we can’t do it without you!
Stay updated with our development! We’ll continue to share important updates on our social media channels:
  E-mail: ogrepixel@gmail.com
Our goal is to create a unique experience for those who love to challenge their minds and are always looking for something new to enjoy, that’s why this game needs all of the team’s attention.
The development process is complicated, especially for all the features we want to include in the game, which is why the required budget has increased to a point where we need the help of people who want to be part of such a special experience that we know our game can be.
Fortunately, the studio was able to keep operating in spite of the ongoing challenges which came with COVID-19. This allowed us to continue our commitment to finish the development of this charming game.
Thanks for taking the time to check out our Kickstarter campaign. Even if you decide not to back us, sharing our campaign with your family, friends and social media would be a great help to us :D

campaign.story:
Devilry is a book of illustrated stories featuring devils and devilry of various kinds:
 Enact a polite summoning in Invitation to a Devil,
 And a friendly but emphatic goodbye in Fond Banishment,
 Experience a static-fogged nightmare in A Devil Upon the Wires,
 Adopt a creature from the deep in a Beached Devil,
 Learn to make the best of anonymity in Greeting a Devil,
 Take a lonely walk on an ancient road in The Stoneymollan Devil.
Fully illustrated with traditional block printing and ink drawings, the stories explore the many forms the devil takes in fiction and folklore, how we use devils to explore fear, cruelty and passion, and how devils are even woven into the landscape.
The Stories
Block printed title page to Invitation to a Devil.
Invitation to a Devil interprets folktales about witch's sabbaths and occult frolicking with the devil. Together with A Fond Banishment, it forms a bookend to the collection, both tales exploring folklore about how devils and evil spirits were summoned and banished.
A page from A Fond Banishment
A page from A Devil Upon The Wires
A Devil Upon The Wires is a short horror story based on a nightmare. Have you ever woken up in the night with a feeling like there is something wrong? Like someone was in the room just a moment before you opened your eyes? Maybe the devil on the wires was there, just a moment before you woke.
A page from A Beached Devil
A Beached Devil is a story of the strange things that wash up on remote beaches. Drawing on my childhood in the Highlands of Scotland, it tells the story of an isolated fishing community that finds a creature washed up on the beach, and takes it home. Are the riches in the depths of the sea worth the price?
Block print title page of Greeting A Devil
Greeting a Devil  is a story about being seen. A woman feels invisible, lives on the margins of a world not built for her, inhabited by people who never have to think about her existence. Until she meets a charming gentleman who suggests that there is power in living on the edges of society, and encourages her to learn a new skill.
A page from Greeting a Devil
A page from The Stoneymollan Devil
The StoneyMollan Devil is based on a real place - Stoneymollan coffin road runs up over the hills between Balloch, a small town on the shores of Loch Lomond, and St Mahew's chapel in Kirkton. I've walked this path many times, and its fascinating history and beautiful, varied scenery seemed perfect for a spooky story about walking alone over the hills.
The Book...
The book will be A5 size, 60 pages including a cover, full colour throughout. As the project is funding super well, I'm also looking at some stretch goals, to improve the book and add other things, see below for details of those as we approach them!
For a few years I’ve been using Inktober as an opportunity to improvise stories, and last year I wanted to incorporate block printing as well as just drawing in ink. The old-fashioned, starkly contrasting images produced by traditional block printing seemed very well suited to stories inspired by the many folk tales of the devil we have in the UK, so I decided to do a block print to start each week, as the cover to an illustrated story about a different devil. By the end of the month I had five stories I loved, and I knew they would make a great book all tied together. It took four months of work on additional art, polishing, and reworking, with several of the stories expanded and reworked, and one entirely new story (A Fond Banishment, to mirror An Invitation to a Devil at the start of the book), and now I have the full 60-page book ready to print. That’s where you can help out!
...And Other Rewards
As well as the book itself (available in both digital pdf and physical form) I wanted to put together some extra rewards to show off the art created for the book, and expand upon the devilish themes. Different reward tiers can pick up these rewards as well as the book itself!
 A piece of original art depicting a one-of-a-kind devil of your very own! Available both as a physical reward, hand drawn in ink on beautiful Khadi paper if you pick the Stygian tier, and also as a digital-only version on the Fiendish tier, still unique but sent as a high res print-ready file, so that backers abroad can get something really special without having to pay shipping costs!
 The chicken's foot print seemed perfect as an emblem on some magical item, and what better vehicle for it than a notebook you can keep your own spells and secrets in! Printed in copper foil onto an A6 notebook, with decorated inside covers and a space for you to write your name!
A page from Flower Knights
Another page from Flower Knights
 Flower Knights is a collection of short stories about knights who are also wildflowers! Drawing on the folklore of wild plants and on the fairy tales I grew up on, I wanted to write stories about knights who were more than strong men slaying monsters and rescuing damsels. Some of these knights slay monsters, some rescue damsels, but they are not all men, not all interested in winning riches, and don't all use violence to solve their problems. They are based on weeds, and so they grow in strange shapes to survive in a strange world. Fully illustrated throughout, this is a cute little square book that forms a great accompaniment to Devilry.
 A collection of A5 print reproductions of all the blocks I used to illustrate this book, including the cover!
Reward Tiers
There are 7 reward tiers to choose from, plus a special early bird offer during the first week!
Stretch Goals
This project has been so much more successful than I dared hope already! I've put together some stretch goals to improve the book and add special extras for supporters!
£3000 - UNLOCKED! Extra stories in the book!
At £3000 I'll add 6 micro-stories to the book! 2 single-page stories, and 4 2-page spreads, each with illustrations in block print or traditional ink, whichever works best for the story. Please note that this reward does mean a slight delay in production of the book from my original estimates. I now expect to start shipping rewards from January 2021.
 £3500 - UNLOCKED! Familiar sticker set!
At £3500 I'm adding a set of stickers to the Familiar tier and up! The 6 stickers are familiar themed - each is a spooky little animal to help with your magical antics! Here are the designs (subject to minor change before printing):
(Note the fiendish tier will get a digital version of the stickers, to print out and keep or decorate online profile pages etc!)
£4000 - UNLOCKED! Original print artwork!
At £4000 backers at Infernal and Stygian tiers will get a piece of original print artwork added into their rewards! ALSO I'm adding the virtual sticker set to the Impudent tier, so if you get the book in digital form it'll come with the set of little familiars!
£5000 - to be unlocked
About Me
Hi, I'm Letty, a Glasgow-based small toad making comics and illustration that tends to focus on cycles of nature and all things unsettling and beautiful. I've been making books and comics for about 5 years, including a Scottish Independent Comic book Award winning graphic novel A Stranger Came to Town. I'm also the lead interior artist on upcoming TTRPG Wanderhome by Possum Creek games, and I have a webcomic about fairies doing crimes at owl-people.com
You can find out more at toadlett.com, or follow me @toadlett.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my first Kickstarter and I am handling it largely by myself, but I have done my research and paid attention to the advice and examples of others far more experienced than myself and am confident I can carry it out successfully.
The main challenge is obviously that of the unpredictable environment presented by COVID 19 and its effect on getting rewards produced, packed and shipped in a safe and timely manner. I have left extra time on the production estimates to allow for any issues around that, and the design part of the rewards is all done and ready to go, minimising lead time on production as much as possible. The only rewards that will need any time to create on my part are the unique devils, and I've limited availability accordingly and set realistic fulfillment schedules to complete these.
The unpredictability of shipping within the UK seems to be easing for now, but obviously is still subject to variation as lockdown restrictions vary. Overseas shipping is likely to face delays, and increases in shipping costs. I have done my best to account for this in my stated shipping costs, but understand that this is an unprecedented and unpredictable situation, and will keep everyone posted via updates as I get to shipping out rewards.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hi everyone, I hope things are going okay for you all! I wanted to check in and show you a few of the things I've been working on for the book - I have the material for three out of 8 of the extra stories done!
The Devil's Laundry
This story will take inspiration from the various iron and sulphur-rich springs which were said to be "where the devil washes his clothes" due to the mixing of these chemicals causing the water to run black at times. Here's some of the artwork and process:

Thank you everyone SO MUCH! I'm still absolutely staggered by how well this did, thank you so much to everyone who backed and shared the project around!
I'll be getting started on the next steps right away. there are three main steps:
Making the book and getting it printed - as I noted when we hit that first stretch goal, adding in 6 extra mini-stories will take a while, so to make sure I get the book finished to a good standard rewards will ship a bit later than I originally estimated. I hope to start sending out rewards at about New Year. of course I'll keep everyone posted on that as I progress!

Oh my gosh woah. Another stretch goal down! That means that Infernal an Stygian tiers will get a piece of original block print artwork! And, thanks to a smart suggestion by a backer, I'll add the virtual sticker set to the Impudent tier.
Here's a closeup of block print artwork in the flesh so you can start getting as excited as me about this! I'm not 100% on which block(s) I'll use, I need to make sure I use ones that are still in good condition for printing as they can degrade over time. I'll keep you posted on that!

THE TAROT TREASURY 
 (I wrote my first book, and I am honored that you are here...looking at my book and reading campaign...and hopefully backing this project so that you can have your very own copy of this book!!).
PLAY

Hi, my name is Lisa Santine.
I am an architect and an interior designer.  I am an artist, a lover of art, a lover of astrology, a tarot card reader, a crystal collector, and a believer that if you do anything with passion and love, it will not only inspire others, but it will help make the world a more beautiful place.
PLAY

(A heartfelt thank you to all of you beautiful souls in this video below).
PLAY

In June of 2020, my dream to design and publish my own tarot deck came true. With the help of the most beautiful backers, my Kickstarter campaign was funded and is currently being fulfilled. I call my deck the Destiny Deck.
During my campaign, I talked about another dream I had, to publish a beautiful tarot companion treasury. I am thrilled to introduce this to you right now.
I CREATED A BOOK...and I am offering it to you! 260 pages of beautifully designed pages.
The Tarot Treasury is intended for anybody to use, not only people who have purchased the Destiny Deck tarot.  This treasury is filled with beautiful illustrations, photographs, and explanations of the meanings behind the Major and Minor Arcana cards in Tarot. Each page is created with love and an artwork within itself.  
As an intuitive tarot reader, I believe we all have the gift to understand our story through the art of tarot.  Now, I want to share the knowledge I have gained throughout the years and allow you to gain an understanding of Tarot through this treasury so that the practice of interpreting and understanding tarot can become more approachable.
From a page in The Tarot Treasury
This book is also intended for the well-versed Tarot reader. It is a treasury that can be used to keep notes and insights in. There are pages for your own interpretations, notes, and ideas.
Every Page is designed with the highest degree of detail
The Destiny Deck
The Tarot Treasury is created and produced with the highest attention to detail.  Every page is created as its own composition. The finest gold foil has been sourced for the cover art. The superior heavy-weight cover is crafted with a superior, beautiful and sensual satin-velvety feel to the touch.  This texture mimics the texture of a rose petal, as well as the Destiny Deck tarot card itself. This book feels amazing to hold and it is a perfect compliment to the Destiny Deck tarot cards. The book is a landscape format 10” x 8” and it consists of over 260 pages of wisdom on the finest heavy weight paper.
Areas where you can write your own notes. This is a compendium of Wisdom that you can contribute to.
Each spread has brought about information that has been beneficial for my clients and for myself. SO I wanted to include these beautiful tools for you.
This is the treasury that I have had endless visions of creating, and I feel so much gratitude for you in helping me manifest this long-awaited dream.  I cannot wait to get The Tarot Treasury and the positive energy it contains into your hands.
Most of all, The Tarot Treasury was created with you in mind.
It was created with love and the belief any positive encouragement can help us walk forward in our journey towards our purpose.
With only love in mind, The Tarot Treasury is my passion project, and I am honored to offer it to the world. Thank you for believing in my work. I know you will love it as much as I do.
I am sending you all so much love.
Lisa, xx
Allow the Universe to lead the way in order to reconnect with the love within ourselves. It is this presence of love that allows us to move past our fears and walk towards our purpose. I love you all. Lisa x

campaign.story:
Though the word "anecdotes" now commonly means "short, amusing stories," its original sense was of a "secret history." In the opposite trajectory, Tarot has transformed from an amusing card game to a supposed container for secret histories of its own. The pictures themselves are anecdotal - narrative miniatures - and like pieces of music, they hold moments and memories.
I "The Juggler" / "Anecdotes"
The basis of this deck is Joanna Newsom's music, which like Tarot elicits obsessive diving and pattern-seeking. The narrators of Newsom's songs are archetypal in the same was as the figures of the Tarot trumps. I began in Autumn 2018 with an idle sketch combining Trump IX (Time, or The Hermit) with the song "Soft As Chalk," and other connections gradually revealed themselves. The result is not a literal or definitive interpretation, but my personal response to both the music and the characters of the cards.
IX "Time" / "Soft As Chalk"
The purpose of this Kickstarter is to raise funds to print copies of the deck. All art is completed, all that remains is to see how many people actually want a copy!

Every card in this deck is inspired by a specific lyric, or a song as a whole. 
The 22 trumps follow the sequence of our old friend, the Tarot de Marseille. The imagery in all the cards has been inspired by other historic Tarots, such as the Sola Busca deck, the "Mantegna Tarocchi," and the decks of the Etteilla school. The songs of the trumps span the entire discography. 
"Wheel of Fortune" / "Sapokanikan" incorporates a design from the so-called Mantegna series
Some depict characters mentioned in songs, such as Monkey (XV) or Colleen (XVII). Others show an imagined narrator of the song. For each, the song has provided a landscape to fit the Tarot character into, whether they are a costumed character of the song or its narrator. 
The trumps: The Fool, The World (flanked by the card-back design) // The Juggler, The Popess, The Empress, The Emperor // The Pope, Love, The Chariot, Justice // Time, The Wheel of Fortune, Fortitude, The Hanged One // Death, Temperance, The Devil, The Tower // The Stars, The Moon, The Sun, Judgement
Each of the other four suits is based on one specific album, with added seasonal and elemental themes. The cards are mostly scenic, but do not follow any one model for illustrated cards. The sequence of each suit was chosen by combining the numerical readings of the Tarot with the story of each album, resulting in a hybrid of the two sources.
The Ace of Batons
The suit of Batons is based on the album The Milk-Eyed Mender, set at the end of summer and associated with the element Fire. These cards all focus on arts, crafts, and the natural world. 
The 14 cards of the suit of Batons / The Milk-Eyed Mender

The Ace of Coins
 The suit of Coins is based on Have One On Me, set as autumn turns toward winter and associated with the element Earth. These cards deal with possessions, homelands, and belonging.
The Ace of Swords
The suit of Swords is based on Divers, set at the end of winter and associated with elemental Air. These cards share themes of individualism, remembrance, and intellectual conflicts.
The Ace of Cups
The suit of Cups is based on Ys, set in late spring and early summer and associated with elemental Water. These cards deal with community, family, and passions.
The cards will measure 4 inches by 6 inches, and will be printed on 330gsm cardstock. Close to the size of the original artwork (about 5x8"), this extra-large card size displays as much detail as possible.
Comparison of giant prototype deck with a bridge-sized playing card. They are G I A N T.
The 78 card pictures, card backs, and borders were all drawn by hand using alcohol markers and colored pencils. I worked on this deck from 2018 to 2020. When I started, this medium was almost foreign to me, but after drawing and re-drawing many of the pictures I've learned a lot.
The card backs have an image of a cameo harp with foliage lovingly lifted from one of my favorites,  The Unicorn in Captivity.
Prototype card back design
There are no titles on the cards - they are marked only with numbers and/or symbols. Each of the five suits has a unique border to allow them to be easily distinguished, and complement the color palette of each image.
The four Kings (clockwise from top left: Swords, Coins, Batons, Cups). The court cards are marked with chess notation.
 The tuck box design features birds who appear throughout the deck... except, a cuckoo? How'd he get in there? 
Part of the tuck box design
Every tier includes the 78-card deck with printed tuck box. I am writing a small guidebook which will be sent as a PDF file. For this campaign, I want to prioritize printing the decks rather than adding the cost of printing booklets, so this guide will be digital only. However, it will be formatted to be the same size as the cards (4x6"), if you'd like to print it yourself.
The funding goal covers the cost of printing 100 decks, 100 tuck boxes, estimated shipping costs, and taxes and fees. 
The estimated delivery is December 2020. If the project is funded, once I receive the funds the order will be placed with the printer in October, and I will begin shipping as soon as I receive them.
The other rewards may include . . . 
Prints. I will get a print of the picture of your choice from a local photo shop. Prints will be 5x7" (approximately the size of original drawings). I will ask your preference in a survey after the project has been funded, and I plan to mail the prints at the same time as the decks. You can choose any card, or even one of the "outtakes" from the deck, if you've been following along! All images are posted on Instagram under #joannanewsomtarot. The estimated delivery for prints only is November, as I don't have to wait for these to be shipped to me.
Art commission. A 5x7" drawing in the same media and style as the deck, subject is up to you! Since this is made-to-order, this will most likely ship later than the decks.
Embroidered card case. An embroidered and hand-stitched polyester felt case for the deck - you can give me direction on the design. Polyester felt is durable and holds its color well, but if your taste in materials is more highbrow, I can use wool felt. Again, these will take time to create, and will most likely ship later than the deck itself. 
Here are some examples of cases I created for other decks.
About shipping: Shipping costs are estimated based on current rates for USPS First Class Package Service. I am not offering to ship prints alone outside the US, as the rate is more than what I'd charge for the print! I learned from my last deck that certain countries, including Italy and Germany, have restrictions on receiving playing cards in the mail from the US. Please be aware of this if you're from one of these countries - if you're interested in the deck, I hope that we can work that out.

Note: This is a personal project and not officially affiliated with Joanna Newsom in any way. 

Thank you for reading, and if you have any questions feel free to send me a message or comment!

campaign.story:
They survived the collapse of society by building a wall...
It circled the town, keeping the good in and the bad out. Families, farms, community, in. Devastation, horror, starvation, out. This is the world Rebecca was born into. At fourteen, she yearns to know what is beyond the wall. Could the world really be as bad as her parents say? Can she find the courage to step outside, to find the truth?
First, it was just curiosity. Just wanting to see what was on the other side of the wall. Then a comic book, of all things, lead to Rebecca being on the run. She ran and didn't look back. She couldn't. Because once you see what's out there, there's No Going Back.
We live in an age where nothing hits harder than the desire to escape, than feeling trapped in your own home. No Going Back is a story of resilience and imagination, originating from that very desire for freedom. 
NO GOING BACK is a 201-page graphic novel written by Mike Furth, illustrated by Anna Wieszczyk, and edited by Natalie Cooper.
"A charming story with atmospheric art. Charming and unsettling in all the right places."  Tim Seeley (Image Comics' HACK/SLASH, REVIVAL)
"No Going Back is a powerful tale for our times. Without casting blame, it illustrates how the desire for safety can lead to authoritarianism, and shows why the young should never blindly obey the rules of their elders. As a celebration of books, storytelling, imagination and love, No Going Back is a delight." Robin Furth (Marvel's DARK TOWER)
"Mike Furth and Anna Wieszczyk pull no punches in this gorgeously rendered coming-of-age adventure of ideology versus identity. Where crossing the line is the first step to crumbling the walls of systemic fear." Dean Haspiel (Image Comics' THE RED HOOK)
"The art is frankly gorgeous with a mixture of surreal and dreamy..." The Newest Rant
"...a story of escape and freedom..."  The Comics Beat

campaign.story:
"Take, if you must, this little bag of dreams, Unloose the cord, and they will wrap you round." - Yeats
The Lost Hollow Tarot is a fully-illustrated 80 card deck featuring an amalgamation of archetypes pulled from the Rider-Waite-Smith, Crowley-Harris, and Golden Dawn Tarot traditions. Each card was carefully researched, designed, and illustrated to allow for both depth of symbolism as well as quick precision in your readings, all while still depicting the grim elegance of its supernatural motif.
Each card is drawn in a red, black and white color scheme that keeps the whole deck unified in one consistent look and feel. The characters in the deck are a diverse cast that bring to life the varied beauty of the setting and its inhabitants. Every card meaning has a considered mediation between its different sources and as such you will see a melding of traditions. 
Pips are fully illustrated with depictions of people and backgrounds like a RWS deck, but also contain symbolism and designs inspired by the Thoth deck, and titles inspired from both the Golden Dawn and Thoth. Meanings of cards follow the three sources, so where one differs from the other two, the more common meaning is applied. Cards ask you to read energy and themes and aren't tied to following specific gender expressions. The characters within are varied in their bodies, races, ages, sexual orientations, and genders (yes, even and especially the court cards, which despite their naming, follow no specific gender expression). 
Cards are planned for two sizes and price points, but both have the same quality card stock and imagery.  The standard Tarot size of 2.75x4.75" and pocket edition size of 2.2"x3.43" are both printed on master quality linen card stock with black core and matte coating, intended for durability, vibrant image reproduction, and ease of handling/shuffling. Each standard size deck is housed in a custom-labelled tin designed to provide protection and longevity even while you’re on the go, and comes with a booklet for quick reference. The pocket edition comes in a textured matte tuck box which provides a quick housing with a decent amount of protection at an affordable price.
The two card sizes
Quality linen cardstock with matte coating makes for easy shuffling even with the larger deck
Every card was designed to read visually at a glance, even with the smaller size, while still containing a depth of occult symbolism drawn from their source decks. Information on how to use this deck will be available for all skill levels! A free PDF download will be available on the website for all to reference, so if you're just beginning, don't feel intimidated, as you should have an accessible starting point! For the standard deck, a guide booklet for on-the-go reference will come with the deck and fit within the tin. Those that already have knowledge of Thoth and RWS traditions will have extra context and flavor with this deck, but that knowledge isn't necessary to get started using this deck.
Lost Hollow Altar Cloth design. To be printed on 21x21" 100% cotton, large enough for a Celtic Cross Spread, Small enough to wrap the deck up in!
The Major Arcana
Wands
Cups
Swords
Pentacles
 "Night is the mother of counsels." - George Herbert
Tarot decks appeal to different people for different purposes. Some just like having an artistic collectible. Others use them for card games like Tarrochini. Some use them for occult purposes and divination. Others use them for self-reflection and self-improvement work. Whatever your usage is, my hope is that this deck will serve you well. 
Here you will find all cards fully illustrated with a rich and diverse cast of characters. I've tried my best to depict them with beauty and grace, but also with just a hint of horror and the macabre. Despite the dark setting, the contents of the deck read with the variety of light and dark themes and archetypes you'd expect from a Tarot deck. Bonus cards of Justice and Strength, each with their own unique artwork, let you choose whether you'd like them numbered according to the Rider-Waite-Smith standard or the Crowley-Harris/GD one. This brings the total card count up to 80, although you'll likely still only use 78 at once.
Funding after the initial goal helps me to recover unexpected  costs, provide better product, and cement further campaigns in the future. As I’ve managed with previous campaigns, my goal with this one is to provide fast fulfillment and shipping after the funding period.
Should we fund, I’m looking forward to offering these additional rewards:

Hello pals! I’m James, and Pixel Occult is the name I’ve  been working under for over six years now. I’ve completed (with all  stretch goals met or exceeded) four Kickstarter Campaigns. Two of those were Tarot Decks based on the RWS, titled the Sinking Wasteland Tarot and the Neon Moon Tarot, respectively. The third was a cutesy cryptid  oracle deck, the Adorabyssal Oracle, which funded two years ago. Last year was the Wayward Dark Tarot, based on the Crowley-Harris Thoth deck.
I’ve been running an Etsy shop since 2016 and my reviews consistently note my shipping speed and product quality, among other very nice and  wonderful things that this community is kind enough to praise me with.
I am an indie creator whose decision making process doesn’t include  target audiences and market research, but rather starts with an idea of  something that I’d like to see exist in the world. Thanks to all of the  incredible supporters out there, I’m able to continue making my dark, odd, and fun projects. I truly can't think of anything I'd rather be doing than researching, designing, and drawing these wonderful decks and I'm so pleased to have the enthusiastic response that I've had for my creations from this community!
This particular deck started out as event posters for our local witchy market here in Portland called Market Obscura, and each one was designed to be a Tarot card eventually. I started making these while I was researching the Crowley-Harris Thoth tradition for my Wayward Dark deck, and I ended up blurring the RWS and Thoth symbolism together in the posters. Then it became a personal task to research and design these together with the Golden Dawn, split out pieces that I liked from each, and then re-assemble them together into something new. I am quite pleased with the result, and I hope that they will perform as well for you in your readings as they have for me in mine!

Even with all of my precautions, some things are  simply beyond my control. 
Finally, a big thank you to all of the backers, friends, strangers,  and fellow internet oddities whose enthusiasm and support continues to allow projects like this to exist and thrive.

updates.update_content: Good news everyone! I'm down to the last few backers and fulfillment is wrapping up. If you haven't received a tracking number yet, be sure to check your messages as I might be trying to contact you for a shipping address. We're sitting at 99% fulfilled right now so I just wanted to take an update to send a last thank you out to all of you for being part of this campaign. It's been a wild and frantic couple of weeks of packing and shipping(and everything else going on in the world as well) and I'm glad to see that the decks that have already been received are living up to everyone's expectations. So, yeah, thanks to all of you for helping bring this deck into the world!

Just realized I had started every single update with some variant of "Hey all". What redundancy! What's another opener we could use? Attention, comrades? Hello friends? Greetings fellows? Anyway, choose one you like and go with it.
Good news everybody, the enamel pins have arrived and so I'll be starting to send out backer rewards today! I'll be figuring out what sort of pace I can maintain so don't fret if you don't get a message with tracking info right away - I'll likely be sending these out for awhile. This campaign has seen double the backers that my previous best ones have, so it could be a bit. Hopefully not too long. I'll be cranking away full time fulfilling these and once I have a handle on my own personal production line and QA process, I'll probably try to bring in some of my kind helpers to speed things up. Anyway, keep an eye out for your shipping message and if you have any last minute shipping address updates to make, now's the last chance to get those changes made.

Hey all! As we go into the weekend, I wanted to address the subject of Add-ons for your backer rewards. I know a big swath of campaigns go with Backerkit to help them keep track of rewards, but I've not dug into that particular source yet and so far have fulfilled all my previous campaigns using Kickstarter's tools. To that end, I'd like to ask that if you want an add-on, DM me about what you'd like. For a quick idea of what I can add on, most anything from is fair game, or if you're after a booklet and only wanted the smaller deck, or if you're an early bird backer but still want a reading/altar cloth(or maybe a second deck) let me know and we can make that happen. Art prints aren't likely at the moment, as my print shop for those is currently closed down from the pandemic/fires and I don't think they'll be back in action in time for rewards to ship out. As far as what to expect for the process, I'll have you bump your pledge amount up by the amount of the cost of the additional item, plus any differences in shipping costs that come with adding extra size and weight to a package. This is how I've taken care of things in the past and (as far as I know) I'm batting 100% on it. Hopefully at least 99% anyway.

campaign.story:
Huppy can´t eat carrots is a heart-warming story about a Rabbit who is allergic to carrots. It’s a book to help children understand what allergies are and how to deal with them. It also comes with a cookbook with recipes that are healthy and allergy friendly.
BEHIND THE STORY
 I had never heard nor had to deal with allergies in my life till we got our first daughter. Just like Huppy we started to discover bit by bit about her allergies. In the beginning it wasn´t hard to adapt to her new diet but when she became older and when the birthday parties, day-care and other social events started, that was when things started to become complicated. 
How do you explain to a 3-year-old, she can’t eat the cake or all the nice food and sweets that´s on the table? As a parent with a child with allergies, you feel the pain that your child can’t participate like all the other children but also the fear that she might eat something she isn’t supposed to.
That’s why I came up with a children’s book to explain what allergies through a story they can relate to. The cookbooks come along with easy allergy friendly recipes to help children look for alternatives and to show that limitations are just the beginning of creativity.
With the books I hope to help as many families and children that have to face allergies everyday and to make people aware of the issue.
 I created a prototype for the books with all the illustrations and cover designs. Only the text needs to be edited
 The cookbook is a trilogy that comes in three separate books; breakfast, lunch and dinner. Each one is divided into different categories no eggs, no gluten, no nuts and no lactose. It also comes with a substitute list of ingredients that is nice to hang up in the kitchen. The cookbooks are downloadable and the recipes can be easily printed out. The recipes come from different families with a small story about their lives.


WHO IS IT FOR?
The book and the cookbooks are suitable for all kids and adults. This is the perfect gift to comfort children with allergies, to make people aware about the issue and to show that healthy and allergy friendly food can be fun to!
WHY IT´S SO IMPORTANT
Allergy is the most common chronic disease in Europe. The current prediction is that by 2025 more than 50% of all Europeans will suffer from at least one type of allergy, with no age, social or geographical distinction.
 Most allergic conditions start in childhood and disproportionately affect children and teenagers, making the chance of a severe allergic reaction during school hours high, yet teachers are often not informed or prepared for such events.  
Studies showed that implementation of public communication and awareness-raising campaigns, helps patients’ reduce attacks, costs and treatments. (Source: EAACI)
PLAY

Altough COVID-19 has had some positive affect on children with food allergies, in a way that social events have been limited. Now schools are reopening and it’s more important than ever to bring the subject up. Not just because of food allergies but also for the children that suffer from respiratory allergies. Coughs and sneezes can easily be mistaken for Coronavirus and children could be the victim of false accusations for being corona carriers.
SOME NEWS STORIES 
https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-london-53990961
https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/9531778/allergy-anaphylaxis-natashas-law/

THE AUTHOR AND ILLUSTRATOR
Eline is the creator behind  ´Huppy Naturals´. She is a graphic and fashion designer that loves to write and design from a very young age.  Originally from Holland but living in Spain for more then 10 years. She just finished her masters in Digital design while being 9 moths pregnant and having two more kids at home. She is mainly working as a freelance designer but after working for different companies she hopes to establish now her own brand.
 FUTURE PRODUCTS
Huppy is not only a character from a book but also the face behind the upcoming brand ´Huppy naturals´. An interior designer brand, that focusses on making allergy friendly and natural products by local production. Many of the illustrations of the book are inspired by the patterns and textiles from the brand and vice versa. There are many ideas of new products and other Huppy books that help children with different kinds of allergies. You can have a sneak peak by clicking on the image below.
If you believe in the project and love it as much as I do, please back me up so that we together can help many more Huppies!

campaign.story:
“Hiraeth is a word which cannot be completely translated, meaning more than solely “missing something” or “missing home.” It implies the meaning of missing a time, an era, or a person - including homesickness for what may not exist any longer. It is associated with the bittersweet memory of missing something or someone, while being grateful of that/ their existence.”
The HIRAETH  art anthology brings together the talents and imagination of 28 dedicated artists.
I’ve always been fascinated by spaces, and the lives we choose to make in them, and the intersection of the magical and the mundane. Inspired by the Welsh concept of hiraeth, or the Portuguese saudade, or the Romanian dor, this anthology was created with home in mind. Included in this book are a myriad of locations - real, imagined, and something in between - inspired by the artist's memories, narratives, and stories.
The final book will be a 6"x9" (roughly A5) matte softcover with over 50 pages of full-color, spread & single page artwork. Perfect bound, the softcover book will also feature a cover from Bex Glendining (@lgions on twitter). 
AJ AZUTILLO / ALEXANDRA "LEXXY" DOUGLASS / ASHANTI FORTSON / ASHLEIGH DAVIS / CAMERON LUCENTE / CARI CORENE / CAROLINE DOUGHERTY / CHRISTINA QI / CIEL BAHENA / CORI WALTERS / C.R. SCANNELL / FINNEGAN J. CAREY / JAMIE LOUGHRAN / JASMINE WALLS / KAROLINE GRØNVIK / KAYLEE ROWENA / KIMBERLY WANG / MARIA CAPELLE FRANTZ / MEGAN KELCHNER / MELISSA PEACOCK / MORGAN MUDWAY / NADJAH O. / NAOMI FRANQUIZ / OLIVER C. / RICHARD MERCADO / RYAN KINGDOM / SARAH DAVIS BAKER / SHAZLEEN KHAN.
So what's new? 
Same campaign, but the initial printing goal was lowered from 300 to 200 books, and a few  of the merchandise rewards were moved to stretch goals in order to drop the initial goal and reduce shipping costs.  The reward tiers were also adjusted slightly — both to give people more variety in reward bundles, and to also lower the price a bit so more people can afford HIRAETH in today's current global economy. We also have some new graphics! Yay! 
Most importantly, however, the artists came forward and agreed to a pay cut to see this book get printed, and it's my dearest wish that we not only get funded, but reach at least our first stretch goal to pay all of the wonderful and talented artists what they deserve. 
Production costs cover everything from printing the physical book to manufacturing the enamel pins to creating the print sets for this anthology. Note that the rewards shown above are not the final, physical product — these are design mock-ups but they are as close to the final product as humanly possible. 
The remainder of the funds will go towards paying Kickstarter's transaction fees, Stripe's fees, taxes, and other miscellaneous transaction fees.
As before, each subsequent stretch goal will also include a payment increase for all involved artists. Each artist will be paid based on their chosen type of illustration, with an additional payout for artists who also contributed merchandise for this anthology.  My main goal in starting HIRAETH was to ensure as large of an artist payout as possible, but I need your support and consideration to make this anthology a reality.
 REWARD TIERS:
 SPECIAL TIERS:
Along with the standard tiers above, and the commission tiers below, HIRAETH is also proud to offer two special tiers for your consideration: 
 MORNING TEA (EARLY BIRD TIER): Get it fast, and get it cheap(er)! The Early Bird Tier includes the full book and merch bundle you'll find in the Oolong Tea tier, but at a reduced price. Strike while the iron's still hot, as this tier is only available until August 16th. 
 HOME IS WHERE THE HEART IS TIER: Sometimes it just doesn't feel like home without someone to share it with. This tier includes a bundle of (2) Oolong Tea sets: one for you, and one for a loved one. Note that this tier includes all digital and physical rewards (books, bookplates, pins, etc).
SHIPPING:
Shipping will be handled by White Squirrel, a small company just north of Seattle that specializes in online store management for independent artists, as well as bulk fulfillment for pre-orders, shops, and crowdfunded campaigns. They work with authors, designers, artists, and all types of creatives to consolidate, package, and ship their products.
White Squirrel has worked with a myriad of talented creators, since 2019, for ongoing fulfillment, bulk fulfillment, and store management and comes highly recommended by the community. They will be shipping direct from the US. You can find more information on who they are and what they do HERE.
HIRAETH is proud and excited to have White Squirrel as a fulfillment partner for this campaign.

Hi All,
I hope it's been a balmy and calm start of summer for everyone!
The prints, pins, bookmarks, and stickers are all officially at our shipping DC, at White Squirrel, or expected to arrive within the next few days. The final round of books went into full production a few weeks ago and should be nearing the end of their creation stage. They should ship out within the next few weeks.
So I'm proud to announce, with much excitement, that we'll start shipping out packages as we head into summer.

Hey all,
I hope you're all doing well and (with any luck) enjoying a new break to some balmy spring weather.  I wanted to provide a quick update as to where we are with shipping and fulfillment:
The enamel pins arrived yesterday and look fantastic! The full run of them are in hand and ready to send out to backers once all the product has arrived.

Hey all,
Checking in with some photos of the printed proofs! Other than a few minor edits on the actual physical book itself, before we print the full run, production has been going smoothly and all of the quality is turning out great. Here's a quick sneak peek of what we're working with, and what you can expect to see in your mailboxes in the next few weeks.

Hi all,
It's been a little while since our last update! 
Printing and manufacturing of all our books and merchandise is now underway. Everything is either still in progress, already shipped out, or awaiting final approval of the printed proofs.  I expect the majority of the goods that have already shipped to arrive by the end of the week.

As short and sweet as it gets: all HIRAETH digital downloads have been sent out.
Please check your email, including your junk folder. The downloads will have been sent out directly from Backerkit and should contain three files in whatever format (.pdf, epub, .modi) is most convenient for you and your system.

Hey all,
Hope 2021 has been treating you all as well as can be. I come bearing happy news:
The HIRAETH .pdf will be distributed on February 15th.
At the latest! Ideally it'll be even earlier than that. The .pdf itself is looking absolutely stellar and we can't wait to get this book in your hands.  We understand parts of this process have taken longer than expected; it's been a weird, tough year with a lot of fresh challenges but the HIRAETH gears have always been turning in the background. Thank you for all of your patience and support!

Thank you so much for your support for this project! Though we did not meet our goal last time, we still wanted to honor our artists' hard work on this project. As such, we've revised our funding goal and are relaunching the project tomorrow!

Our team of artists has worked hard to create beautiful pieces, and we would still like to be able to produce this project, so our mod team is planning to relaunch in early 2021 with updated goals in the hopes that we can still make this project a reality.
